Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Powershot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: M. Ybarra
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement camera for an old nikon digital camera.  I was not disappointed.  This is a great camera.  I did my research and wanted one that would take great pictures and also shoot hd movies.  This camera has a lot of good reviews so I decided to take the plunge and buy this one.  This camera has a great zoom lens.  I have always been disappointed with my old digital cameras because of their lack of zoom capabilities.  The 20x's zoom on this camera is fantastic.  One of the best features I like about this camera is the hd movie mode.  I hate having to lug a camera and a video camera at the same time.  This camera takes wonderful videos so I do not have to carry my video camera around.  I have a mac computer so when I import my photo/videos into iphoto, it has the ability to view/play them all in the same application.Pros: Great Picture, Great Zoom, Great Video, Point and Shoot Mode, Advance modeCons: Bulky, Lots of menu options if not shooting point and shoot mode, Flash can be overpowering at time depending on setting(I have not had time to see how to adjust this).  Video mode needs good light source to make great videos, the lower the light the grainer the video.Overall, I would definitely recommend this camera for purchase.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS CAMERA!!
Reviews.Author: Melissa 13
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!!!!  Absolutely amazing!! It takes the best pictures.....so clear and crisp and so easy to figure out all the settings!! If you are looking for a new camera ....this is it!!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: D. Adair
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my Daughter to take pictures of our new grand daughter.  The pictures are great she loves the lcd display and ease of use.  Might not be a camera for a pro, but for great and easy pictures it does a great job.  Would be nice if it had a molded case.Free shipping and scary fast delivery

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I have Ever Owned..!
Reviews.Author: Marcos M. Sendon
Reviews.Content: the easy of use, the ability to save custom settings, the optical zoom range, the articulating LCD screen, the high definition video capability, steady shot...the macro shot...i'm running out of breath...My point is that the features this camera has is as close as you can get to a full blown slr without having to carry multiple lenses, filters and all the other acutraments that an slr requires to reach it's potential.The built of the camera is totaly solid. It feels sturdy. The workmanship is first class. The playback menus are truly noteworthy. Zooming and cropping your pictures is as easy as can be. The video playback menu is stellar. Most cameras its push to start playback, push to stop. The SX20IS has a full ranged menu that includes playback, pause slow mo, ffw, rew, advance to last frame, go back to first frame. It is the most extensive I have ever seen.The price is as good as it gets. and with Amazon prime, it doesn't get any better than that. The only drawback was the lens cover. With such an outstanding product, greter care should have been placed to protect a critical element of your investment.Bottom line, this camera is an excellent investment if you care about preserving your memories.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Paul St Amant
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic.The crispness of the shots are outstanding. I'm really happy to own it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  Please note that an SD memory card does not come with the camera so be sure to purchase if/when ordering.

Reviews.Title: Did alot of shopping, 2 months and no regrets.
Reviews.Author: Orklord
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. It took a day of heavy use and experimenting to get used to the many options, but the camera usually did great on just the auto setting.  The pictures are great, and it did an excellent job of recording my 4yo's Christmass production.  I was able to zoom in for close ups from 30yards out. Even at max optical zoom and no tripod the camera did a great job of keeping the video in focus. If it does go out of focus just back up the zoom level a tiny bit and it will autocorrect very quickly.  I dont yet have the HDMI cable for the camera, but even with the RCA plugs the video and pics are awesome on our 46" samsung550 Tip: I disabled the digital zoom so that I wouldn't accidently decrease my quality by zooming too far.

Reviews.Title: Cannon SX20IS camera
Reviews.Author: J. Wizner
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon SX2IS camera which was very good.  The SX20IS is a big improvement. It is easy to set the enlarged group of shooting modes and the zoom is terrific.  I am getting excellent pictures.  The camera is very easy on batteries.  The only thing I don't like is the lens cap, it is difficult to install and remove.  I would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: rodder
Reviews.Author: Gary Duensing "Rodder"
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price.Pretty easy to use for a beginner or anyone who has some experience taking photos.Quality of photos are pretty good,haveen't tried to use the video much,it's a little more difficult to use.All in all,pretty good piece of equipment,would reccomend this product.

Reviews.Title: SX20is
Reviews.Author: stharbor99
Reviews.Content: I just love my Canon camera! I saw it at the NYC camera show but waited to purchase when I return home through Amazon, got a great price. I have been taking pictures of everything, this is my first camera of this size. I have a Canon SD800 does a great job, but this SX20 is the next step for me! for a camera of this size. My son has the Rebel and we compare pictures of the same items, and the SX20 is holding its own, and I am enjoying every minute of taking all kinds of pictures with it. I'm a Grandmother and I enjoy taking pictures of flowers, grandchildren, farm houses and motorcycles and so far perfect! and the SX20is is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sew Fun
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur that needed a really great camera for product photos for my business as well as for my family, and it has been great for all.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: a2z_auction "a2z_auction"
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted to move up to an EOS from an Elph.  I decided to try this camera out instead.  We really didn't want to deal with lenses and any of the manual selections on the EOS.  This camera has a great zoom and flash.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: This camera is a winner.
Reviews.Author: E. Downer
Reviews.Content: In the process of choosing a camera I decided to forego the more expensive SLRs and stick with the best available point-and-shoot variety. The way I went about narrowing it down to the Canon SX20IS was simple, I researched every single customer review that I could find on every dealer's website. What I found was that for the most part the negative reviews referred to some very trivial criticisms like the lack of a printed manual or the lack of an attachment to secure the lens cover. Perhaps the only serious negative comment that I could find referred to the camera not providing RAW output. I can live without it.On the other hand, having bought this camera, I now agree with the reviewers who liked in particular the swivel screen, the quiet 20x zoom, the automation and the picture quality. Sure, it would be nice if Canon had included a printed manual but it seems that most manufacturers today are moving towards their documentation on electronic media.If I had to think of one or two negatives it would be the lack of internal memory which is included in most other cameras in its price range, also the lack of an HDMI connectivity cable for my HD TV.The SX20IS is so feature-rich that it will take months to use this camera expertly, but once you get the hang of it you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with one unfortunate caveat.  Overall would recommend.
Reviews.Author: John Hunter
Reviews.Content: I was planning to buy a digital SLR until I came across this viable alternative.  With a hotshoe for a flash (which works with my 380EX Speedlite from my 1990's EOS ElanII), manual controls and an awesome relatively wide to ultrazoom lense, I was smitten.  Knowing that I would be substituting some lense quality for portability and convenience, I ordered the camera.  After playing with the camera around my house and yard, I'm very content with the picture quality, speed, flash, and versatility.  The only caveat is the focusing ability; it's not even as good as my decade old Elan or my relatively compact PowerShot A710 IS.  If the camera has a face to focus on it does a decent job, but if you're not taking a picure of a face it's mediocre.  I did notice that when using the camera in real life scenarios (and not just playing with it around the house) it did better than I thought it would.  Less than a week after purchasing the camera I got to really test it out.  I was invited to a CBS taping of the Reba Thanksgiving special.  Unfortunately the audience only had 30 seconds to take pics of Reba (absolutely rediculous).  Well the camera payed for itself!!  I got 25 pics in those 30 seconds using my 380EX Speedlite and only a couple were out of focus.  Anyway... I love my PowerShot SX20 IS: awesome pics, amazing and versatile lense (zoom and wide angle), quick performance, versatile settings (from point and shoot to complete manual), articulating screen (realized it's benefit taking pics of Reba), and good HD video.  The only negative is the mediocre focusing that isn't really that bad now that I'm using it to take actual pics and not just test shooting.  Would highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera-  Great Pictures once you learn it
Reviews.Author: Joe Shmo
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all the talk about poor picture quality.  If you want to just put the camera in Auto mode and expect perfect shots then you will be disappointed.  Once you read the manual and learn how to use program mode and all the other features you will soon realize that this camera is amazing.  The ability to change the ISO settings by pushing a button is a great feature along with so many other useful features it is impossible to explain them all here.  One draw back is they dont give you a tether to hold the lense cap to the camera so I keep misplacing it.  The HD video is great and I am very happy with the picture quality.  The zoom is also amazing.

Reviews.Title: My Canon SX20 IS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Armchair Shopper "M. Simpson"
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced a Canon A610 that was dropped and broken. The A610 was a 5MP camera but still took excellent shots (if the correct settings were applied). I found many features of the SX20 IS similar to the A610 but being a 12MP camera with 20X optical zoom I believe it has the potential for better distance shots and taking HD quality video (again, if the correct settings are applied). Since I have only had it a couple of months I am still learning the finer aspects of taking high quality pictures and finding the correct settings can be complex, particularly for a novice user. That said, I can't say it is the best camera for the money out there even though it's predecessor, the SX10 IS, was highly rated by Consumer Reports. It is not what I would call highly portable as it has the size and heft of some DSR cameras and I will probably buy another smaller camera that I can just put in my shirt pocket for every day use. The only real bones I have to pick with Canon at this point is that they could have designed a better quality access cover for the download and HDMI ports and a lens cover that is attached to the camera via a tether to prevent loss. The cover could also be made to get on and off easier. In summary, it seems to be a good quality camera but still to soon to pass final judgement. Will post another review after I've had some more time using it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: E. Sweet
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the Canon powershot SX20IS.  The pictures are great but you need a tripod of some type when you zoom in on a subject. Unless you are very steady. The camera is easy to use although the guide tells you very little.  The buttons on the back right side could be situated in a better spot so that you don't keep hitting them when you go to hold the camera to take pictures. Over all I like the camera and will use a tripod when needed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Barnhill
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade from an older model Powershot. It is a great camera. It is very easy to use and makes wonderful, sharp photos.  Even on fully automatic setting the pictures turn out great. The 20X zoom is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: CaseyT
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my husband, the family photographer, to replace an older digital camera that he still managed to take great pictures with.  Based on other reviews and the price point I hoped it would be a hit. His take is that the feature set, ease of use and conventional battery usage made this just about the perfect mix.  He was able to easily take advantage of all of the features because of the intuitive controls and after spending very little time with the manual has produced video and stills of exceptional quality.  He's delighted and so am I.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: James B. Johnson "JJ"
Reviews.Content: So far I am very pleased with this purchase.  The only issue I have with the camera is the lens cap.  No attachment, easy to loose.Other than that, it appears to be a very good camera.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: A very nice camera for the money
Reviews.Author: J. Seelye
Reviews.Content: This camera will do everything without carrying a big bag of extra parts.  The video is 720p resolution and when played back on a good TV it is as good as it gets.  The video focus works great and being able to zoom while shooting makes all the difference.  The stills are prefect--great lighting, color and focus.  I would like a higher resolution view finder--the one on this camera is a bit fuzzy to my eye.  I guess I could learn to use the lcd display, but I still like the view finder for composing my pictures.  I really like my new camera.

Reviews.Title: The bulk of an SLR, but quality of a point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: student 09 "student 09"
Reviews.Content: I have used a variety of Canon digital cameras for at least eight years, and this is the first model with which I've been disappointed. I'm not a professional, but I do enjoy photography as an artistic hobby. I wasn't sure if I wanted to spend the money on a DSLR, so I bought this as a step between that and my point-and-shoot. After a year of using it, I realize that I should have invested in the DSLR. I viewed a lot of sample photos online, taken by others who own this camera, but unless you are using a tripod or shooting outside, the average quality of this camera's photos are just not impressive.Picture quality - While the high megapixels are a positive, I find that unless taken in ideal conditions (bright sunlight), the photos come out grainy and/or blurry, so they look low quality anyway. No amount of experimenting with the ISO or other features has solved this. Also, objects in the photos aren't clearly defined - there is often a blue or white fuzzy edge around the subjects. One of my biggest complaints is that in most lighting conditions, especially indoor natural light or outdoor cloudy light, there is an extraordinary amount of white blowout. The 20x zoom is great, but again, unless you are shooting in ideal conditions, it's hard to get a crisp shot.Video - The video is high quality, while not professional, but for everyday use, it's convenient to have HD video options as well as photos in the same camera. I especially like the "record" button on the back of the camera, which is much faster than having to turn a dial to shoot in video.Body - This camera is as large as a DSLR, but for the added bulk, the picture quality is just not worth it. The camera itself weighs about a pound, but takes four AA batteries, which adds a lot of weight. Having gotten used to a rechargeable battery in my previous camera, I can't help but notice how expensive it is to keep buying new batteries. Battery life is average. I've had some difficulty opening/closing both the battery lid, and the flap lid for the memory card (I have to force them to move). The shutter button frequently gets stuck, so I have to try multiple times, and I have frequently missed the shot that I wanted because I couldn't make the camera take the picture. More often, I have to apologize to people posing for the photos because it takes a good fifteen seconds, and a lot of wiggling the shutter, before the picture is taken. The one feature that I love is the large screen that you can flip in any direction.Features - The list of features seems impressive, but when actually put to use, none of them contribute to a higher picture quality. I have never gotten a clean shot using macro, a feature I loved on my previous Canon.All in all, this camera takes photos equivalent to a smaller, cheaper Canon Powershot, but for twice the cost, it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, well rounded
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews, but I love to read them before I purchase anything.  So I felt a duty to write one this time.  I am not a pro photographer, not an amateur either, somewhere in the middle.  We have had a lot of camera's over the years either Nikon or Canon.  I would probably say after owning both I would be a little partial to Canon.  We have a Canon T2i currently, but I wanted something more portable for family vacations.  I didn't want to buy another camera and camcorder, and I saw this one in a store and was instantly drawn to it thinking it would fill my needs for an upcoming vacation.  While the SX20is isn't what I would call small and light, it certainly is compared to large SLR's.  I bought it after researching and testing others in this niche and have been very pleased with it.  After our vacation, I was reviewing some of the photos and videos we took with this little machine and was actually quite surprised.  I am used to the look of a photo taken by a nice digital SLR so I had already kind of doomed this thing before it really had a chance.  It really did surprise me!  While the photos aren't as sharp as SLR (as others have mentioned), they are very good.  I do suggest printing out the manual ( I know it's a bummer), but it is well worth it.  Use the manual settings, after playing with it for a bit, these settings are not hard to remember.  It will make a difference in your photos.  The videos we shot were very clear, had nice audio, and so easy to play back.  Overall, extremely happy with this purchase.  We bought a bag to carry it in, and I strapped it around my shoulder all day, every day and was so happy not to be lugging around a huge bag with a whole bunch of lenses.  The trade off?  Well, not much if you ask me.  We have some amazing photos and videos to remember our trip by and I don't have to go to the chiropractor when I get back.  Get this thing and you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: Almost impossible to take a bad photo
Reviews.Author: E. Augustus "WWII history buff"
Reviews.Content: I have had cameras, and worked with developing my own photos, since I was eleven years old. I would never consider using anything but an SLR. I started my experiences in the world of digital photography with the Apple QuickTake, and when the first digital SLR camera came out, I was in heaven. I have gradually upgraded every few years, whenever I felt like there was a camera that justified the expense, and doubled the amount of megapixels from the one I owned at the time. The last time I bought a camera, it was a five megapixel Olympus E-20 in 2002 - eight years ago (I think that was the designation). Now that I'm retired, I just needed a good quality camera with a high megapixel count, an SLR shooting system, a flash, and a reasonable amount of versatility, including video. That seemed like a pretty large goal to find within my very limited budget.When I found the Canon Powershot SX20IS camera was only $350, and had very high reviews, I just hit the "Buy with One Click" and waited to see what I got. What I got was an absolutely fabulous camera. If you're not interested in all the features, all you have to do is stick the batteries in it, put it on auto, and start shooting away. Eventually I went through the manual (yeah, I know, bad form for computer geeks), and got to know some of the more sophisticated features. One other attribute I found really outstanding was how long the battery lasts. The last few digital cameras I had were real battery-eaters.I'll cut this short because this camera is fantastic. If you're sophisticated enough to want an SLR, just hit the "Buy with One Click" and look out your front door a couple days later. You'll have an extraordinary camera out there.

Reviews.Title: One Sweet litte Camera
Reviews.Author: OldAnalogGuy "OldAnalogGuy"
Reviews.Content: I usually don't get very pumped over cameras anymore.  I've had so many over the years that I guess I've been jaded.But this Canon changed all of that.You can be shooting within minutes of installing the batteries and memory card and making some of the best pictures you've seen.The 20X zoom is just fantastic and coupled with the vari-angle viewfinder, any angle is no challenge.Even though just a JPG format, the pictures are incredibly sharp.  The colors are saturated and deep.  Control of parameters is simply vast, but not overwhelming.  Start with 'auto' and then move up to other choices.Wait until you try the video!  Absolutely beautiful.  Play it back on your TV in high definition and you'll be blown away.The Canon software that comes with the camera is quite good.  I usually just photoshop everything, but the Canon software stores and fixes most pix quite well.I know that point-and-shoot you've been looking at is small and fits in your pocket nicely, but this is just a little bigger and will do so much more.  Not many more bux than a good point-and-shoot, either.If you can't tell, I love this sweet, little SX20IS camera.Sorry, you can't have mine, you'll have to get your own! :)

Reviews.Title: Great Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon Himes "woodland watercolors"
Reviews.Content: This is my third digital Canon camera. I only replaced my last one because I'd left it in the rain and it (temporarily) stopped working. I'm glad I decided to upgrade to the SX201S camera. It has an amazing 20x zoom and with the stabilizing feature I can take photos of distant birds with surprising clarity.I like the viewfinder adjustment feature that lets me use the viewfinder without my glasses as the digital display isn't particularly useful for finding a bird on a branch. I can zoom in and get details I haven't been able to catch since I gave up my film camera. I like the automatic controls that are familiar from my other Canon cameras and the fact is uses regular batteries is a big advantage to me.I wish there was a better manual with this camera and I hope to find something online that will explain in detail how to use some of it's features. Since I am an artist using photographs as reference, I need a camera that easily helps me get the birds and other subjects I want.  This camera is even better than I hoped for that use and I enjoy it a lot.

Reviews.Title: cpete
Reviews.Author: cdp
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I took it to an art workshop at a California Mission and had many opportunities to give it a try. It was so easy to use and took such beautiful photos - I think 2 other people were going to return home and order one. I do wish it came with a manual as well as a CD though.

Reviews.Title: First couple weeks review.
Reviews.Author: Shadowtripper
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera on recent reviews.  No surprises, I attached lens cap with lens cord and super-glued to cap the first day.  Other than a flimsy lens cap, this is a great camera.  Just returned from a ski trip, carried it in my fanny pack.  Terrific color, ease of use, stabilization and best of all, the telephoto!  Interior night shots were excellent, low light not a problem.  Recommend a class VI (6) or above SD Memory card for quickest camera response in writing to memory.  Battery (rechargeable) not a problem, even in cold weather.Camera still new to me, but has exceeded my expectations to this point.  No video shot yet.Strong buy recommendation if you are looking for a larger than pocket camera, but smaller that Nikon standard body with most or all of the features at a reasonable price.  Best of all the optical telephoto lens eliminates carrying additional lens.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews about this range of cameras, I bought Canon SX10IS. It was taking great pictures but did not have HD video. SX20IS came out few days later, so I returned SX10IS and bought the SX20IS using Amazon's 30day return policy. They even didn't charge for return shipping. Great service.Anyway, now I have SX20IS which takes even better pictures and HD videos.I am impressed with the quality of HD videos this camera makes. If you are moving the camera while taking videos, have to move slow to get smooth video and avoid video stutter. But still it's quality is better than Panasonic camera I looked at.It's a little heavy due to 4 AA batteries, but cheaper and less bulkier than SLRs. I had to buy a lens cap holder $1.50 and a hand strap around $6 (not really needed, but secures the camera from falling). Lens hood provided (when attached) seems to put a small shadow at bottom center of the picture taken (not very significant).Overall I am very happy with the picture quality and video quality. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: Happy in DBQ
Reviews.Content: A good camera that has many of the functions of a DSLR, but without all of the price.  We don't use it as much as we'd like to, but it's a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: BnHbaeb "thrifty shopper"
Reviews.Content: Very well put together. Takes terrific pictures, and videos. Absolutely no problems after almost 2 years. And it was refurbished. My brother in law bought a new based upon my experience with this camera.

Reviews.Title: cannon powershot sx201s 12.1mp digital camera with the 20x wide ange.
Reviews.Author: Babby Blair
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for quite awhile now. It was easy to learn how to use and it takes GREAT pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little Camera
Reviews.Author: Ross J. Mehan
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX20 is a decent, all-around camera.  It's light, compact, and has a lot of features for the money.  It's also the last model that uses AA batts--this is huge to me.  I dislike proprietary batteries on consumer cameras--with AA's you can get them around the world, and never have to worry about not having a charged battery.  Yes, you may get less photos per set of batts, but you will always get your photos.  I think the still camera is decent (excessive noise reduction is annoying), but I mainly use mine for video.  Yes only 720p, but very nice.  You have a manual focus and manual audio overide which is amazing in a consumer camera.  The IS works great too.  I also like that the SD card has it's own door--you don't have to open the battery compartment to get to the card--yes, a small point, but when you shoot a lot of video like me, it's important.  Images are good on the entire range of the zoom--I know this camera is obsolete, but it has a niche in my photo needs and I love what it does for certain needs.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Vicki Green
Reviews.Content: I am well pleased.  Received a person call from the store with a question. Offered me a longer warranty for free.Very professional. Camera is just exactly what I wanted.  This is definitely a camera for someone that just wants to point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: good and mediocre
Reviews.Author: Melisa Premer
Reviews.Content: Been using for a couple of years now.  Mostly went with max zoom rather than DSL because i have 3 kids in school and wanted it for performances and such.  Zoom, especially when pushed to digital limits, is relatively useless in stage situations.  Due to low lighting, need a tripod which is difficult in a auditorium setting. I guess I expected more from the stabilizing feature.  If there is low light the human heartbeat makes the camera shake icon come on if you zoom at all.  When I discovered you can turn the intensity of the flash up and down, I thought that might help.  However, if you have any foreground objects, such a people's heads, the glare off them ruins the picture.  Not really a criticism of the camera but my own knowledge of the workings of photography and what I needed.  I have taken marvelous outdoor shots of people, nature and sunsets.  Party pics where a flash is possible are very good too.  I just expected a little more for the price and the bulk.

Reviews.Title: Call for Help Please -- Macro
Reviews.Author: L. Mann "Books, Cats, Life is Good"
Reviews.Content: I like the sturdiness and heft of this camera, and the ability to download photos to my laptop. Generally the photos are crisp with use of Auto, but I cannot get the SX20 to focus and shoot details of the center of a flower, for example.I mourn the loss of my thirty-five year old Minolta, for which I had several lenses, but could take exquisite macro shots with the 80-200 telephoto. Could  someone please provide the steps taken to achieve macro focusing with Sx20? There is a "flower" icon on the wheel, and an M on knob. Believe me I've gone over manual, etc., but can't seem to get it. Thanks for any help!I recommend this camera for someone who has experience with digitals (I did not) and who can easily interpret the instructions in order to use Manual settings if they so wish.

Reviews.Title: E32 Error Beware
Reviews.Author: PERLA MOLINA
Reviews.Content: the camer itself was great, with good quality pictures. However, there was electrical error E32 that happens to cameras and costs the owner $159 to fix!  I already shelled out $500 for this camera, I've only used for 3 years. It's not that great of a value if you are having to fix it at 40% of it's original cost.  And of course it happened after the warranty expired...I think cannon is a good company, but I wouldn't recommend this product if you are an active user.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: MJ Shopper "~ mj ~"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for the person who loves to take pictures. I researched many cameras before I bought this one and I fell in love with this. I can take close ups from a great distance and although I am not a professional photographer, I sure feel like one! The pictures come out clear and crisp. Has many different choices to choose from and when recording the sound quality is great. The camera arrived beautifully packaged and I would buy this again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ginger
Reviews.Content: I have had my Canon Powershot SX10IS for a little over 2 years now. The quality of my pictures are amazing,for the price I have paid for the camera; and I love how you can zoom in to take a picture without the pictures being distorted or fuzzy looking. All my friends and family are impressed with the quality of my pictures, and frequently ask me to take pictures for special events.  I gave this product a 4 star instead of a 5 star, because I have had issues with opening up the battery tab, to change out batteries. It's always been very difficult to open. And this past summer while trying to change the batteries, the inner tab that holds the battery tab shut broke. And now there is no way of keeping my battery tab closed, besides using duct tape ( Which I might add only holds for a short period of time). And I have recently discovered there is no way of being able to repair this. Would I buy this camera again...........My answer would be YES, but I would make sure that I bought the extended warrenty.

Reviews.Title: Amateur No More!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 years ago after weeks of researching every known brand with a photographer friend hooked on Nikons.  This camera made a believer out of both of us.  It's perfect for someone who doesn't have a clue (ie: me) and takes amazing pictures.  I've used it everywhere I go and the images I've gotten are high-quality and my photographer friend even commens on the image quality despite low light, weather conditions, distance, etc.  I know just enough (now) to adjust for lighting and the best thing is that this camera takes the pics so quickly with immediate results that I can make a quick adjustment and keep right on going.  It's light and small enough to fit in my carryon/purse so I take it everywhere.  I wish it was rechargeable but if I use the batteries for digital cameras, it lasts for hours (and I go crazy with pictures, trust me!).It's worth every penny and I'm loving the pictures and fun I've gotten from this investment.  I look forward to traveling and am now the designated photographer for trips, parties and just wandering the streets.  I've gotta start gettin paid for this!  With the SX20IS, I'm not an amateur any more!!

Reviews.Title: My Canon PowerShot SX20IS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last June specifically for my family beach trip. I've had Canon cameras all my life - most of them PowerShot models (previous camera before this one was Canon PowerShot SD600 6MP Digital Elph Camera with 3x Optical Zoom), but this was my first "hybrid" point and shoot/SLR camera so I was open to other brands. This camera had one of the highest ratings online and after seeing it in person, I was sold.One of the things that initially drew me to the camera was the design. I have small hands and I wanted something that I could handle and shoot with ease - and not drop. I really liked that the screen flips because my chances of scratching the screen would be greatly reduced. Over a year and not one scratch! I've taken this camera to a windy beach, Vegas, hiking, and let various technologically challenged family members and strangers use this camera. I'm impressed with it's durability.Taking pictures is really easy and the images come out beautifully. My main reason for buying this camera was for my annual trip to the beach and I'm really glad I did. The HD video is fantastic - great pool time moments.If you're a fan of Canon cameras and aren't quite ready for the complicated SLRs, go with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Kris E. "KE"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a friend's recommendation and I love it.  The photo quality is excellent, especially in macro mode which I use a lot.  The instruction booklet is a joke, so I just ordered a 3rd party manual.  Overall, I recommend this camera without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Review
Reviews.Author: Kevin M. Sutton "Sutts"
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great photos and even a novice like me can use basic sets. Have ot delve online to learn the more intricta eworkings. Camera was delivered promptly and in excellent shape.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Karl Nakonechy
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with a canon, the pictures are just great and easy to use love my new canon

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: N. Ngoc
Reviews.Content: I had a SX10 before and got this SX20IS after the old one was stolen.  This new SX20IS is awsome and I am very happy in using it and showing it to others.  Works great in well-lit conditions as outdoors as camera and video recorder.  Inside the video is grainy and picktures need to be "vibrant" up before printing.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera - hate the lens cover (needs a leash)
Reviews.Author: 1feistymama
Reviews.Content: I am definitely a point and shoot photographer, not an SLR user.  But scrapbooking is my main hobby.  With 3 kids, 2 who play soccer, I was looking for a camera that would take good, movement pictures from a distance.  This camera fits the bill perfectly!  Granted, there are times when a tripod is necessary to eliminate all of the blur.  That's just true of ANY camera that zooms from a far distance.We can take close-up shots at home without washing out the target of the photo.  We have taken excellent outdoor photos under all different lighting situations.  We've taken pictures of the Christmas lights on the house without blur - many digital cameras blur out and you don't see the detail.  Every picture comes out perfect ----- unless there's some human error in there which happens on occasion.We've taken videos in the snow - often times, filming snow is difficult.  Not with this camera.  It's as clear as it was in person.The kids are bummed because I let them use the old camera.  Not this baby --- not for $400!!  This is mom's toy and Dad is lucky to get to use it on occasion.  Too many times, he's flipped the viewing screen open AND LEFT IT OPEN when he placed the camera down.  That's how it gets scratched.It gets 4 stars instead of 5 because of the Lens Cap and the Hood ---- I've lost BOTH and had to replace them.  The lens cap doesn't have a leash.  Seriously??  Hubby lost that at Yosemite.  He took it off and put it down in the floorboard of the car.  Later, we assume he kicked it out of the car when getting in or out.We left the hood on permanently after that until I lost it at the zoo.  I was walking around with the camera on my shoulder, hood on the end, ready to grab it at a moment's notice.  I looked down at one point and the hood was gone.  The fit was always a little loose and I guess bumping against my hip loosened it enough for it to fall off.I have now purchased a new hood and lens cap (both through Amazon, totalling $20 for both).  The replacement cap has a leash!  That leash will keep both the cap AND the hood on the camera.

Reviews.Title: For less of 400$.....
Reviews.Author: JOSE
Reviews.Content: It's a very very good camera, powerfull zoom and focused pictures taked on hands. You don't need a tripod. Even at maximum optical zoom. Wide angle, isn't exception...it is enough for close photos. Quality of lens is awesome, for a 400$ camera you can't obtain nothing beter....I don't need interchangeable lenses, I have obtained just what I need to make wonderfull pictures....Canon is Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX 20 review
Reviews.Author: V. Polavarapu "Vik"
Reviews.Content: It is not for SLR-results bent-of-mind people.I bought this camera only because of :- being a former S3 IS user whihc gave good results outdoors.- hot shoe , external flash option to bounce light- I hate to carry SLR's.- For me Good results are Great enough.- I can use light scoop.Pro's :- AA battery's- Hot shoe flash option- Manual mode controls on surface and can be used by thumb- Solid and sturdy built- Lots of options- ZOOM IS GOOD- Very good results with light scoopCon's :- Picture Quality can drop if you do not know the controls well- If you need to use zoom, you need tripod, else your get grainy pics- software is slow sometimes.- Little bit more heavy than expected- You need to know atleast above-basic fundamentals of photography- Flash recharging is slow- No proper filter groove to protect lens. You need to buy a seperate adapter for the 58mm filters. Very stupid design at the part by canon.- The green focus light is intrusive if you want to do a children's photo sitting.All sub-$800 camera's have these many con's. SLR's and peripherals are another money pit if you take that line.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Mdride
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for two months and made some test photos to get to know it. The image quality is excelent and the zoom range is impressive. I like the configuration of the controls. I hope the control lableing doesn't wear off and leave me guessing what button does what (my Fiji Finepics S5700 lost its button IDs in the first year). Power by "AA" batteries is a requirement for me because I standardize on rechargeble "AA"s for all my electronics that I travel and hike with. I expect to use the articulated LCD view screen for those overhead and waist level shots that were so frustrating with my Fuji. I have seen the benifit of the image stabilizing with just the few test photos I've done so far.  The SX20IS is heavy compared to my fuji Which is a plus for holding it steady but a negative for packing light. Also the grip for the right hand is a little slipery which with the extra weight makes those necesary one handed shots harder to control. I am frustrated with having to go on line for the users manual. I don't always have access to internet or a computer and if I print it on my printer it is a big package. I think Canon could print the manual on thin paper in a compact format that would travel nicely with the camera.Bottom line. Can't wait to really use this camera on trips and hikes.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera l have ever had.
Reviews.Author: Foladex
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot Sx201S is a product l feel inlove with and l cant use any other product except canon powershot.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera!
Reviews.Author: cb
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few days before I went to a concert, and I was able to get great pictures and videos! The zoom is amazing! I would highly recommend this camera, it is well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Brandee J. Beavers "Brandee Beavers"
Reviews.Content: Great camera with wonderful picture taking features. This camera makes it very easy to take awesome shots. There is ease of use in this camera. Takes beautiful close up pictures and movies. The only downsides are the cheap lens and strap. Although the camera came with a disk with information I would have preferred the booklet on camera features and instructions. I had to order the book separately from amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Happiness Flows
Reviews.Author: Russell J. Centanni "Russ Centanni"
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth digital camera I have had, moving to the Canon brand after my previous three Kodak digitals gave me their heart and soul as I have traveled to 17 different countries in the last 7 years. Five countries are on my horizon for the month of March and I will be putting my new camera to the test. In the few weeks I have had SX20IS, I have been most statified by the clarity of the viewfinder and the LCD screen which I typically use to review my shots. I was an SLR guy before digital and I really tend to use the viewfinder all the time. I like the fact that the battery needs are not proprietary and in a pinch I could pick up double A's if the rechargeable NiMD's are on the charger. To date most of my shots have been wildlife, in house family shots, and a couple portraits; in each case I have been fully satified especially when I have run the zoom out to 20X and the sharpness of the image has been maintained with no graininess. As I gain more expoerience with the camera I will be able to say more but for now "happiness flows." If there was one thing I would have liked to receive, in the box, with the camera it would have been a full printed manual. The one on the CD has been uploaded to my computer but I like to make check marks and dogear pages and you can't do that on line. Thus if you are like me, you will print hard copies of the important pages you want to have on hand. That is what I did.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MN guy
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this camera to replace an older Cannon S2 IS powershot.  I initially purchased a Nikon Coolpix L110 to replace the 5 year old Canon and wow that thing was junk. Twice the mega pixels as the 5 year old Cannon but half the image quality. Canon is by far ahead of the pack when it comes to picture quality and image stabilization. Buy this camera you will not be disappointed!P.S. If your looking for a small light weight camera this ones not for you

Reviews.Title: Gosh this is  good
Reviews.Author: M. Hetu "USA2UK2008"
Reviews.Content: This is the first Canon I have purchased. Now I see why people say they are the best. I have purchased a lot of cameras in the last five years and they are all bad compared to this one.  It is heavier than my others but worth it for picture quality and the fantastic zoom.  I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot sx20Is
Reviews.Author: Jeannie Baker
Reviews.Content: I just got bake from Alaska the camera was easy to use the pictures are great .

Reviews.Title: Love my new Powershot
Reviews.Author: jkwfrisbee
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I ordered the Canon Powershot after doing some research on other digital cameras. I really liked this one from the reviews I had read and the look of it on the website here. It arrived shortly after purchasing it and I must say that I love it. The picture quality is excellent so is the video camera. The instructions were a little difficult to use but we figured it out quickly. Overall I am very please with it. But the ultimate test will come when my fiance and I go to the beach and take pictures but I am sure that it will turn out great!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Thomas Sutherlin "Senyo"
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I bought the S3IS a number of years back and loved it, so I decided to give this one a try. Its almost exactly the same, except better in every way.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: S. Dilbeck
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera. The quality of the pictures is good. I haven't used it very long, but from the pictures taken so far, the zoom, is wonderful. The pictures are very clear. It is not your really small camera, which I was not wanting a tiny camera anyway. It is the closest thing to an SLR camera, without the higher cost that SLR cameras are. I am still learning about it, but I am glad I purchased it. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Chyea!!
Reviews.Author: AlaskanMom
Reviews.Content: This camera is friggin amazing! Its defiantly my favorite out of all the cameras iv ever had!The only thing i didn't like, was of course the lens "CAP". The cap isn't attached or tied to the actual camera. Iv lost the cap a bunch of times, then one day I accidentally dropped it off a dock & into the water & ain't gettin it back anytime soon. Now i have to buy another cap before my lens scratches..Other than that one flaw, the camera is fantastical & completely worth buying!-Hails.

Reviews.Title: Review by amateur
Reviews.Author: W. L. Walter "Granny"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted the terrific zoom lens, a variable angle LCD, jpeg photos, and a viewfinder.  I previously had a Canon so I figured the learning curve would not be too steep.  The camera is more than I expected, actually, and now I'm interested in learning about it.  It's a shame that Canon is too cheap to include a Users' Manual. Someone has written a book for the Canon Powershot SX20 with good ratings on amazon (but for $30), so I'm going to buy that, although it irritates me to have to do so.I do wish the lens cap was attached.  I've already lost mine and will have to get another.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS delivers great pictures
Reviews.Author: A. George
Reviews.Content: I have a PowerShot S5 and so was already familiar with the Canon features and workings.  The PowerShot SX20IS delivers great pictures, great DVD quality video, great audio, and does it all in about the same size and weight as the PowerShot S5.  The 20X zoom is really great.  The wide-angle zoom provides a very wide fiedl of view with very little edge distortion.  In most cases, I was able to stitch together panoramas using the wide-angle lens photos without a problem.  Coupled with the anti-vibration feature, you can take great telephoto shots.  The only thing I wished it would do that it doesn't is to allow longer than 15 second exposures.  Otherwise, it does everything I want and much more.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Cristie Boulware
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son who was having a new baby for Christmas due to Consumers Report and they loved it. I then bought it again for my daughter who just had a baby. They both love it.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ulrich Ernst "L'Economiste"
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon 7D with the Canon 70-200 mm f 2.8 IS lens, a close-up lens, and a few others. However, for some reason, airport security (especially in Frankfurt) thinks that a lens is indistinguishable from a bomb. So every time I travel with the camera, I have to go through the entire bomb-sniffing routine. It'll be nice to zip through with the smaller camera. And I just love the articulating LCD -- finally a way to get shots from the ground up without writhing in the dust, as it were. It's obviously not going to replace the 7D, but will be a good camera for traveling either alone or as a backup.When I noticed the thread in the lens, I explored whether a UV filter or a polarizing filter was an option. Canon wrote back and said it wasn't. Alas, there is a converter that allows 58 mm filters to be attached. I have ordered a UV and a polarizing filter, but haven't had a chance to work with them yet.

Reviews.Title: Great everywhere it matters!
Reviews.Author: Donald A. Moery
Reviews.Content: Is it easy to learn all of the features of this camera in a half hour.  NO!  But if you stumble along you learn a little bit more every day and the experience is wonderful.  I'm 73 years old and have a house full of cameras both 35mm and digital.  By acutal count I own seven digitals going back to 1999.  For everyday use I use my fabulous ultra tiny Canon SD1000 but for challenging my photog skills I love the SX20.

Reviews.Title: Worth the $$$
Reviews.Author: Ira J. Walker "IJW"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Totally flexible and easy to use. The photos are soooo sharp and the HD video is very nice. I haven't really done any night shooting yet so I couldn't comment on that, but over all this is a camera that you'll be glad you spent your money on. The Auto setting is very good. If you switch to manual settings you will have tons of f/stops and ISO and aperture settings to adjust making this a near professional camera. I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great as a starter
Reviews.Author: B. Karczewski
Reviews.Content: This is the first digital camera I bought. I have had experience with a wide variety of cameras including SLR's. While this doesn't come close to the quality of an SLR, it does very well for the price.Pros:>Fast zoom, with ability to zoom slower>Great settings, The landscape setting is great, sport setting works very well, a host of other settings to still try.>Manual focus, it takes some time to learn though.>stitch mode for panoramas makes it very easy to put together amazing panoramas.>Video quality is great!>Battery life is great!>The articulating LCD screen is great!>Start-up time is very fast>There's a fireworks setting, and it works very well once you get the timing down.Cons:>Lack of sharpness, photos do appear soft. Nothing photoshop can't fix up.>720p video uses a lot of power, and a lot of memory card space.>You can hear the zooming while zooming on video.I've used this camera over the course of four days at an air show, it performed very well. Can't compete with the quality of some SLR shots I've seen, but this camera got a lot of good photos. The video is VERY nice, so nice that one of the performers featured my video on their website.Night shots are great as long as the ISO is low to avoid noise, got some amazing lunar eclipse shots. Macro shots took some time to get right, the auto-focus has trouble with a close subject, that's where the manual focus comes in handy.Overall very happy with my purchase. It's great for a starter camera to get to know the controls, settings and have the ability to take some high quality video on a budget.EDIT: About a month after purchase the camera failed with a "lense error". Apparently a common problem, contact Canon support and they will repair it under warranty.

Reviews.Title: Good camera in small package
Reviews.Author: E L "Mit"
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st point and shoot. I've owned 5 DSLRs to date. The way I use sx20 now as a baby SLR and HD camcorder. If I stay away from full auto, I'm very much OK. Picture IQ will never reach the high level of DSLR. I carry the camera every where now w/out the big bag of lenses and accessories. I shoot HD footages and converted them to ACVHD dvd .The video is beautiful if played on blue ray player. My dedicated Canon flash works wonder on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Returning it today
Reviews.Author: C.Snow "usmcjsnow"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as an upgrade from my Kodak Z740. The pictures taken with the Canon were brilliant and amazingly clear on the viewing screen. Then I uploaded them on my computer, and it turned out that the photos were not as clear as ones taken with my old camera. I even did an "experiment" where I took the same images with both cameras and showed them to several people. Each of them chose the Kodak image in each pair as being the clearest with the brightest colors. So I'm getting my $400 back today. It's not a bad camera, and has some good features, but my Kodak takes much better pictures even with lower resolution.

Reviews.Title: Fits the bill!
Reviews.Author: Karrie
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera all around! I have used SLR's and have found myself limited in ways that this camera enriches! This is a one stop shop! You can take snapshots, and you can all take detailed photos of the moon (for example) it's portable and ready to go when you are! A+

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: G. Whittle
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, exactly what I wanted.Not a DSLR but still takes great pictures.I am still getting used to the camera so haven't used all of its features yet.I am still experimenting with it, but I think this will meet my camera needs well.I can't believe that Canon don't provide an owners manual, I have printed the manual but to carry it would be like taking a thick book around. Come on Canon don't be so mean!All in all I am enjoying using this camera and am pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY WITH NEW CAMERA
Reviews.Author: DAX XENOS "DAX"
Reviews.Content: I WAS MORE THAN HAPPY WITH THIS CAMERA AS IT HAS SO MANY THINGS THAT I CAN CONTROL.  IT HAS GIVEN ME GREAT VERSATILITY FOR NIGHT PHOTOS USING NATURAL OR AVAILABLE LIGHT AND WITH GREAT RESULTS SO MUCH SO THAT SEVERAL FRIENDS ARE GETTING THIS CAMERA.  I ALSO FOUND THAT AMAZON HAD THE BEST PRICE THAT I COULD FIND.  SINCE GETTING THIS CAMERA HAVE TALKED TO SEVERAL PEOPLE WHO ARE PROFFESIONAL PHOTOGRAPHERS AND THEY HAD NOTHING BUT GOOD THINGS TO SAY ABOUT IT.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for those wanting more than point-and-shoot without complexity of dSLR
Reviews.Author: A. Ali
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera before my trip on a couple of sight-seeing adventures. I knew I wanted more than a simple point-and-shoot camera because although the pocket-carrying convenience is great, the pictures don't always come out great. The last thing I wanted was my first trip to the Great Wall to leave me wanting more in terms of a camera.The only inconveniences: (1) the initial setting for a 2-second lag between taking pictures. However, I was able to change the setting on the camera so it did not show the preview, and then it was ready to take another picture within milliseconds. (2) at times the camera was too big to have so I didn't take it with me when going out at night, etc.The good: I was concerned about the battery; however, I took approximately 800 pictures and combined total of nearly 15 minutes of video on an SDHC Class 4 card, and only had to change the four AA batteries once during the 10-day trip. The pictures when I took a few seconds to position the camera and focus on the shot came out excellent. The ones where I was clicking just to capture various things came out okay. This is to be expected. The zoom was extremely handy. I have never had the luxury of such an incredible zoom -- once I used it to zoom into a road sign a couple of blocks down just to make sure we were walking in the right direction! And the pictures zoomed in came out good (not grainy).I ordered the camera on a Thursday evening on Amazon, and had the camera at my doorstep on Monday afternoon. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: TomSIU
Reviews.Author: Tom Strawther "Tom"
Reviews.Content: I am an arson investigator for a major insurance company, and this camera really meets the requirements of my job.  The camera is compact, easy to use, and takes great photos.  The adjustable LCD viewer comes in very handy.  Good camera for under $500.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Oreo "camerabug"
Reviews.Content: I had another Canon camera and loved it. However, I wanted to be able to zoom in closer on birds and animals from a farther distance without loosing quality and this camera is so much stronger and has such a nice quality picture that I am totally enjoying my new camera. It takes nice clear, crisp, sharp closeups even from many feet away, thus allowing me to snap pictures of birds in the trees as well as my feeder without disturbing them. It is very easy to use and since I'd already owned a Canon PowerShot there were not many features new to me so the user friendly guide was very helpful on the few new features that my old camera didn't have.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for it's size...
Reviews.Author: Konacoffee
Reviews.Content: I am a serious hobby photographer who normally uses a Canon 50D DSLR; however, sometimes I want something a little smaller yet something I can still "get creative" with type of camera.  This camera is it.  Not to mention the video is incredible, especially the telephoto...I was amazed.  I even love the low light ability.  Now, of course I probably can't enlarge my photos to the size I would on my "big gear"; however I may be surprised and you will be pleasantly surprised at the quality of this camera.  I love shooting manual and it simply works well for it's size.

Reviews.Title: Brand new as of 2 days ago
Reviews.Author: annieokie
Reviews.Content: I like it. It's heavy, but managable. I am having trouble understanding the icons so I need that book I ordered to arrive soon. It's on it's way.I've taken about 50 still shots and all were OK. Movies, nope, not so good, but I need to learn to use it properly. They were clear and colorful but I'm shaky. Can't do the tripod thing because I use a walker to get around.I mostly take shots of wild birds in my yard, trees and at my feeders, then post them on message boards.I think someone younger than I, with a quicker mind and steadier hands will love it.The viewfinder was an absolute must for me. The articulating screen was a plus that I didn't expect. I love it!!If I have any major complaints I'll come edit this.AnnieUpdate as of April 5, 2010I am in love with this camera. Once I learned how to do the settings and changed a few of the factory presets I am taking the best pics of my life. I have 5 birdfeeders surrounding my patio where I sit most of the spring and summer. The pics are coming out beautifully. Very true colors and I have been told my pics are even better than last year. Many of my pics are shared with other wildlife lovers on message boards. I also have 13 nest boxes placed around the perimeter of a very large back yard. I can see the birds little faces peeking out and the shots come out nicely.My Dad was a professional portrait photographer. I have decided this camera is taking better photos than the fancy rig in his studio.Just for fun and as another learning experience I took a photo of a friend from about 250 feet away while he was clearing brush from a neighbor's burn pile. It looks like he only 20 feet away. There's no mistaking who he is whe you see the pic. His face is in perfect focus and his big new orange dirt mover is an absolutely perfect representation of the color.I have become used to the increased weight and am much steadier in handling the added weight. Only took a week to get used to it.Years ago I had a 35 mm SLR plus huge lenses and I ran around under parachute jumpers taking their pics while coming down. This camera could easily do the same job with lots less weight and no long heavy lenses.The low price is a bonus for the quality of this camera.Annie, one happy Canon SX20IS owner

Reviews.Title: Great hybrid camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon texas shopper "Amazon shopper"
Reviews.Content: Only real minus of this camera is lack of interchangeable lens, but that saves $200. Takes great pictures. I suspect those complaining about pictures it takes are imaging when shutter speeds are too slow, I just set the camera to "TV" (Time Value) to use 125th of a second shutter speed, and then blurred pictures due to too slow shutter speed never happens; Poor pictures could occur in cases where auto focus can get confused. Has many great features, but REALLY, one should read the Guide! However the real User Guide is not included in hard copy form, it's on the Program CD or online as a PDF file. Included is an abbreviated "Getting Started" Manual, it's good for starting, but you do want the fuller "Camera User Guide". Once one learns where all the buttons are and what they do, this camera is a joy.Love the 20 to 1 zoom, and the LCD screen. And yes you can use filters on the lens if you buy a Janco 58 mm adapter ring.I'm now using Rechargeable AA Ray-O-Vac Nickel Metal Hydride Batteries, that over the life time of the camera can save enough to pay for the camera, as opposed to using Alkaline batteries.

Reviews.Title: Best I have ever had!!
Reviews.Author: A. Bowers
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera. I wanted something that would capture all my sons good and not so good moments. So far this has been the best one I have has so far. I was sick of pictures coming out blurry and ruined and I have yet to have a picture that I didnt like and alot that I LOVE!!! If you do manual it can be hard to figure out but auto will do it all for you.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Norman C. Schoenborn
Reviews.Content: the camera is very user friendly which I like, had trouble with the view finder, had to call canon to get help, there is a little wheel by the view finder that has to be adjusted, good pictures, tried to get a plate number of a car a over a hundred yards away, couldnt see it with the naked eye but with the 20 times zoom it was perfect. the LCD viewer could be a little bigger but its okay, mainly bought for sports advents to get better pictures, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera with a couple of setbacks...
Reviews.Author: TXbywayofMS
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a couple of weeks ago to snap some great shots of my newborn. This camera takes some excellent photos once you get it out of the automatic settings. Using the automatic settings still allows you to take some great photos. High ISO setting naturally will add some noise to your pics when taking low light shots but this can be greatly reduced by using a tripod. Overall quality of the camera is great. It is heavy and well built. Battery life is pretty descent.Here are my qualms- Canon did not make threads available for lens filter for this camera. You can buy an adapter for this from [...]but this takes away the option of using your lens hood as the adapter uses the bayonet where the lens hood and would normally attach. It also negates the lens cap when using the lensmate adapter. Canon should have included threads for filters. The Canon sx20is also does not offer remote shutter capabilites.Overall this a great camera.

Reviews.Title: An excellent Addition
Reviews.Author: Silent Warrior
Reviews.Content: We have several digital cameras. But our Canon PowerShot 20IS is great. Well I should not say our's. I bought it for my wife as a 30th Anniversary gift. She has been estatic with the results. Thanks Canon for being a stalwart over the past 34 year in our family.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Marge Schechner "momcactus"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement to the Canon Powershot SX5IS. There was no problem with the 5 but I wanted the longer zoom and this camera has it and then some. I've taken indoor shots, macro shots, portrait shots and used the optical zoom in combination with the digital zoom and it performs beautifully. Unbelievable colors with foliage setting, fabulous close ups, amazing quality using the zooms. Canon makes very high quality cameras and if you don't want to go up to the Rebels and an SLR, this is the camera for you. The only negative is the size and weight but with all the bells and whistles that this camera has, it probably could not fit in a smaller camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good Super Zoom Camera
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: This camera replaces my Panasonic FZ30 which replaced my FZ10.  I really liked both of those cameras but they both failed to turn on one day.  So far, feature for feature, for a super zoom camera, I like it except for one feature that I am really going to miss and that is burst mode.  I don't understand why that feature could have not been added, I use it often but that is just me.  If this feature isn't important to you then I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: It doesnt get bigger than this !!
Reviews.Author: Adi
Reviews.Content: Just what I wished for. I am not a pro or a wannabe photographer, else I would had gone for a dslr or slr. I wanted something that gives me dslr alike features, super zoom and optical stabilizer among other features. This camera has incorporate these and a lot more dream features in the best possible way I have seen so far. Image quality is great, stabilizer works great even at max zoom and you can reach much far than your eyes can possibly image. I just love this piece of machinery. Its worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Annoying Lens Cap~ Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ginamia "ginamia"
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera for college football. That means afternoon outside sport shooting. I have gotten great action shots. The video is easy enough.I really like the adjustable viewfinder so I can shoot and watch the game. I have handed the camera off to 13 year olds and they are taking good pic's.I just changed batteries today,I have a couple hundred photo's a handful of video. Changing out the batteries was awkward the fitting seemed off. The batteries lasted longer then I expected. I plan on doing the rechargeable route with 2 sets so I always have charged ones on hand. The lens cap is a huge hassle!! I would pay for a better lens cap. This one is cheap and doesnt fit well. It leaves the lens unprotected because it will pop off. I also would like a old fashioned type of camera bag that fits the camera. Other then the lame lens cap and bulky camera bag options this is a great camera for my use.

Reviews.Title: Chalk me up as another victim of "lens error"...
Reviews.Author: Trailhoundz
Reviews.Content: After only 1 1/2 years of usage, my SX20 started with the infamous "lens error" issue (which I've found out plague many Canon SX cameras). After beeping, the camera attempts to shut down with the error message on the screen. It's impossible to re-start and use. I tried several tricks found online- new batteries, going back to factory presets, checking for dust and dirt-- but to no avail. I'm VERY disappointed. Customer service at Canon was less than helpful and would only offer me a 'refurbished' SX30 if I sent my SX20 back WITH a check for $300 (!!). This is my third sub-par Canon digital camera (LOVED my Canon Rebel G film camera)and I have to say, I will be switching brands for my next camera.As to image quality... I found this camera average compared with my other Canons but enjoyed all the "scenery" buttons- lots of fun to play with. DEFINITELY sub-par for action shots though--anything moving came out blurry unfortunately. I bought it mostly for photos of my dogs running and playing, but after set after set of blurry shots, I switched back to my DSLR for those types of photos, and used the SX20 for "still" shots only.After my experience with the SX20, I would not recommend any of the SX-product cameras.  Not sure I'd recommend any Canon as a brand either.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I previously owned a Canon Powershot, and I wanted to replace it for a newer camera that would take pictures faster and had more zoom.  I purchased the Canon Powershot SX20IS because of it's features, and I wasn't disappointed.  I found it to be a little heavier than my last camera, but that wouldn't be a deterent for purchasing it.  We took a trip right after I received the new camera, and my pictures were wonderful.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: RIGHT PRICE,,RIGHT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: John ABEGGLEN, Jr. "EL JOCKO"
Reviews.Content: IM NOT AN EXPERT,  IM NOT A BEGINNER..JUST A OLD GUY WHO LIKES TO TAKE PICS...AFTER A MONTH OF SEARCHING, COMPARING, AND NOT WANTINGTO BREAK THE BANK, I CHOOSE THE CANON POWER SHOT SX20IS...THIS IS A PICTURE MACHINE, AT A PRICE THAT "WILL NOT BREAK THE BANK"...ITS NOT A LIGHT WEIGHT PIECE OF JUNK, BUT A WELL MADE CAMERA THAT WILL SERVEWELL...I COULD GO ON AND ON, BUT SOMEONE ELSE WILL DO THAT FOR ME,,YOU KNOW THE ONES THAT KNOW MORE ABOUT A PRODUCT THAN THE PEOPLEWHO MANUFACTURED IT, NUFF SAID

Reviews.Title: I'm not so happy with mine
Reviews.Author: Old! Florida Cracker "Dang Skippy"
Reviews.Content: I've had mine a couple months now, and I don't like it. Let me say first - the ONLY thing I don't like about it is the quality of pictures it produces: They're just not sharp. I can't say if it's the lens or sensor noise, but they're not sharp. I've tried every setting available, fast shutter, low ISO, mid-range aperture, flash ... I can't get a sharp, enlargeable picture out of it. Even 8x10s aren't sharp.Color reproduction is awesome: bright and saturated, but just not sharp.I AM a professional photographer - a variety of newspapers since 1974 - and carry around a sack of Canon DSLRs. I was carrying a Kodak Z1275 in my pocket for that rare moment when I didn't have an SLR hanging off my shoulder, but it eats batteries. It's razor sharp, but it's very serious about its AA batteries ...And the SX20IS is absolutely silent - vital for some situations such as courtrooms.I wanted the articulating screen and I'm a Canon lover so I bought, after looking at several others with similar features, the SX 20IS. I wish I'd bought it from Amazon, I would have returned it right away. I bought it at my local camera store, but ... His no-return policy has left me with a camera I really don't like.I've shot lots of stuff for my newspaper with it - its quality is good enough for the paper - but I can't print, frame and hang anything out of this camera, and I have a bunch of stuff hanging in our local library and city hall shot with the Kodak Z1275 - and have won several ribbons with some of those shots.I thought maybe I'd gotten a lemon but a friend bought one (I didn't know she was looking for a camera, and she bought hers where I bought mine) and hers is similarly not-sharp. She's not as picky as I am, though, and I didn't say anything to her about it because I know she can't return it - She's happy enough.cjnlakewalesnews.com

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: melquist
Reviews.Content: The auto focus is not as bad as some reviewers have made it out to be.  Occasionally I got a blurry image (I would say about one out of fifty pictures).  But all in all, it is a wonderful camera.  I took it to Greece and Turkey, and I am pleased with the shots that turned out.  The zoom is superb!  In Greece, I went to a temple at Soulion where Lord Byron carved his name on the marble.  Although the temple was roped off, and I was at least twenty feet away from the space where the signature was evidently at (I couldn't see it with my naked eye), I was able to zoom in on the signature and get a clear shot.  I just thought wow! what a great camera.  I am using the pictures in my art history and humanities courses that I teach.  For the non-professional, this is a great choice that delivers professional looking images.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: This is the 1st Camera that I've used that is what you would call a level above the regular point and shoot. I read both the good and bad reviews before choosing this camera. In regards to the bad reviews I can only surmise that you either got a bad one or didn't read the manual. Consumer Reports rates this one as a good one and my experience so far backs that up for me at least.In regards to pictures I've taken, I've only used the auto function so far and when I'm comfortable with that I'll move up to using the more advanced features. I've uploaded a few of my pictures to Amazon and I made a note that the pictures were taken using the auto function. I hope the pros reading this won't judge me too harshly but like I said this is my 1st camera that is at this level. Most of the pics were great and the ones that weren't were caused by my moving too much while taking the pictures.If you are looking for a camera to take you to the next level from point and shoot, then this one will work nicely. One thing I did notice is that while filming video if there is a lot of wind it does cause a lot of rumbling in the audio portion but the video portion is excellent. So I guess my suggestion there is don't film in a lot of wind.And one last thing, the 35 page manual that's included did a great job of explaining the basic operation of the camera and how to use some of the features. Some people complained about not getting a manual but if you just need to get started the enclosed one works well and if I need to know about the more advanced features I have no problem firing up my computer and reading the PDF that's on the enclosed CD. Canon is just doing their part for the environment by keeping the camera package size down to the minimum which not only saves trees but also shipping cost.

Reviews.Title: BIG BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!
Reviews.Author: freestyleFrEaK
Reviews.Content: In today's economic atmosphere, it's hard to find a good value for your dollar.  I don't know about you, but it seems manufacturers of products and service providers are gradually cutting back here and there, never dropping their prices.  It seems we are gradually getting less of something, while constantly paying more.  Enter the Canon SX20.This is where cutbacks stop and value for your dollar goes through the roof.  Ten years ago you'd only dream of having a compact still camera that takes quality pictures like this along with pure, crisp, sharp, and great sounding HD video!  Easy to use, although a little bulky, it has a solid feel in the hands and takes fantastic telephoto shots!  A couple of drawbacks are the continuous photo option which snaps pictures at a measly 1 per second, and the fact that a full users manual in print is not included in the package (however a pdf format on disc is included, and we all have computers nowadays don't we?).My friends and I used to judge our digital cameras on how well they  could take a night shot of the moon.  Generally, all we'd get is a bright white spot.  With the SX20, you'll be amazed at what the moon can look like!  Blow up your shots, and you might even see some inhabitants!Made in Japan, and as usual a leader in quality, Canon once again does not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: Does It All and Does It Mostly GREAT! Owned 6 months
Reviews.Author: Debra Koch
Reviews.Content: 20x optical, image stabilized zoom that you can use while filming.720P HD video with great sound.Hot Shoe for adding a flash for low light.Ability to use AA rechargeable batteries-don't have to wait for charging another set or purchase expensive 2nd proprietary.2.5" articulating display and electronic viewfinderWide angle - scenic shots and great for group picsHDMI out connection.Ability to take a still shot while recording video.Lens will extend with lens cap on so it doesn't break if I forget it's on.Beautiful still shots in good light.Full manual mode ability as well as point and shoot - increases ability to take quality pictures as you learn I moved up from an olympus sp-500 which I loved except for 3 things. First,I could not zoom more than half way without blurring as it had no image stabilization.Secondly, the video was very poor which was expected at the time of purchase.Last, but not least the new canon has wide angle compared to the old olympus.I find that I take videos often now that I don't have to spend extra moneyfor a dedicated camcorder plus have to drag it around with me.My olympus only allowed zoom to 5x without shaking, now I can zoom to 10xor more without shake. Also, the older superzooms did not allow zooming whilein video mode. Zooming more than halfway requires good light and reallybracing myself especially when subjects are moving. I will purchase a tripod to increaseopportunities to take up to 20x zoom in those type situations. Also, I'm using automaticand scene modes so I have no idea what the full capabilities are in manual mode. I wouldexpect that if you know how to adjust settings, it would greatly increase camera's abilities.Still pictures taken in good light are excellent even without the superfine or raw modesbut I still wish I had superfine. Great macro mode shots.Pictures taken in low light do show more noise than my older camera. At least,when I look at an actual sized picture on my computer screen, it either showssome kind of slight graining or it looks soft (noise reduction?). Again, manual settingsmight make a world of difference. I wonder if it is because they added those extra megapixelson the small sensor that causes it like one reads about online. If so, I sure wish they hadnot done that as this would be the PERFECT camera otherwise. Of course, thenI would never need to upgrade unless the camera actually broke.I am planning on buying a dedicated flash to see if that makes a differencein low light but using onboard flash works. Also, action shots are sometimes good,but sometimes not the best but that's to be expected.There is a lady on the reviews that added links to her landscape images andthey really show you what beautiful pictures this camera takes in good light.I mean they are stunning.
