I have not learned how to apply manual settings soI'm sure that would make a lot of difference in image quality and that isanother benefit of this camera is that it allows you to manually change thesettings as you learn how.I had a hard time between this and the pana FZ-35 but the articulating screen,movie file type, battery type, and the odd joystick on the panasonic were the deciding factors.Plus, I didn't like how it felt in my hands. As far as low light pictures, my research tellsme that all the small sensor ultrazooms will have some difficulty unless you know how toadjust settings to compensate for it. If you don't mind using flash, it doesn't matter anyway.We really love our new camera and have been using it since Sept 2009. I amupset that all the camera makers have chosen not to include the more detailedmanuals as that means I have to print out 185 pages but that does not detractfrom how great the camera is. I'm having fun editing my movies frommy all around, does it all, and does it mostly great, canon sx20IS. Plus, I getto buy a dedicated flash and tripod to take full advantage of all the extra featuresand expand the capabilities of taking great shots in even more situations. Then, mynew canon will be the "PERFECT" camera and I'll never need to upgrade. HA!

Reviews.Title: SX20 A Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Al "Cub Fan"
Reviews.Content: Overall a excellent camera.  For the price, you get a lot of camera.  It's not perfect, but it will take some excellent pictutes once you know how to use it and get around some of it's quirks.  I just came back from a week's vacation and used this camera extensively.  My son and son-inlaw both have canon DSLR's and took a lot of the same picures I did.  When we viewed them on a HD screen, I could not tell the difference between our three cameras.Pros* Has lot of features.* Light weight* 20 X Zoom.  Really lets you get close.  The 4 X digital gets you closer* 720p Video.  With 8 GB SD Card, I can get over an hour of video* Stabilization is better than I had with Canon S10* Excellent battery life with rechargeable batteries.  Energizer has good bateries that charge in 15 min* AA battery size which you can buy anywhere vs a proprietary battery which is more expensive.* 12 M pixel good for cropping* Fairly fast lens so it takes decent low light pictures if it focuses OK.Cons* No Manual but I printed it out double sided with 2 pages on a side = 45 sheets of paper.* As others mention focus in low light is tough. Sometimes you have to go to manual focus.* It has so many features; you need to study the manual to take advantage of all the bells and whistles.* While taking video, at times loses focus and correct exposure.* My view finder doesn't do a good job in displaying the picture I took. Sometimes looks over exposed

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: I'm having fun with this camera.  It takes great pictures.  I'm still learning about all of it's capabilities, but so far have been really happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Almost a great camera
Reviews.Author: Gordon D. Gillespie "Hobyist"
Reviews.Content: I've had to purchase an adapter ring in order to use a UV and other filters.Camera does not always switch automatically from viewfinder to view screen.Colors under certain desert conditions are not true, regardless of sun angle.Have owned three Fuji cameras and would have purchased a fourth, save for poor construction.

Reviews.Title: This is the best digital camera we ever had......!
Reviews.Author: Anu "Anu"
Reviews.Content: I think it is worth. We love the picture quality and ease of use. This is the best camera we ever had so far. We also bought this camera to take video instead of carrying two different camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is good enough for entry-level amateurDetails that I like include:optical zoom up to 20x;use of AA batteries;lens hood that protects the lens;the articulating LCD;

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: Duane Beggs "duaneb"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the Consumer Reports Review.If you need 20X zoom and 720 lines of video, it is a gooddeal.  My wife likes to video wildlife in our backyard.The automatic photos I took are not so good.  If you don'tneed the zoom and video, then get something else.  However,if you will treat the camera like a DSLR, things get better.Use aperature priority and dial in F 2.8, set the white balancemanually and play with the exposure based on the luminance graphand you can get some good portraits.  I thought the macro wouldbe a good feature, but with depth limited to F8, forget it.  Youneed F18-22 for close up photos of flowers, etc.  I was expectingmore and maybe I'm missing something, but four stars may be high.

Reviews.Title: toylike build
Reviews.Author: Jack West
Reviews.Content: i was very disappointed with the dark small viewfinder. also the door for sd media was toylike & very flimsy. the "stats " looked great on paper but i have buyers remorse now and should have paid more for the G-11

Reviews.Title: Decent but not good enough
Reviews.Author: Grad Rosenbaum
Reviews.Content: I tried this camera and the Powershot SX1 IS. The SX20 picture quality is noticably inferior- as is the video quality. I called Canon and they explained that the CMOS sensor in the SX1 IS is the primary driver as to why the picture quality is better and it's the reason why the camera is more expensive. I'm sticking with the SX1 IS despite the higher cost- it's worth it

Reviews.Title: So far So Good
Reviews.Author: W. Burkhouse
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera yesterday. I am just a regular consumer not a photographer but so far I have been very pleased with this camera. The HD video looks great on my TV. If you just want to take great photos of kids this is your ticket.

Reviews.Title: Detractors, be GONE!
Reviews.Author: Speaker to Animals
Reviews.Content: This is a heck of a camera.  My only complaint is that it could use a small price drop.  The lens just drinks in light --you folks whinging about the picture quality, try NOT using the flash.  In fact, you should go out of your way NOT to use the flash whenever possible.And you point & shoot cattle:  realize that this camera is actually more of a hybrid, and actually try reading the manual a little, and maybe play around with the ISO settings.  This camera gives back what you put into it.  If you are using it strictly as a point and shoot, with flash a'blazin', you are not just asking for, but begging for disapointment.Lastly, the video quality is just lovely, clear and crisp.  What strikes me is how fine the sound is.  I can move in close to a live band and catch everything, all the notes, each musical nuance.If you are a Canon owner, you are one of the elite, the proud.  Start acting like it, people.  Remember: the only two digital camera makers worth their salt these are Canon and Sony.  The others are just a lot of pretty bells and whistles  (Yes, Panasonic, I am tawkin' to YOU, too).The rest of you just return the camera if you still can, or sell it on eBay, and then go to your corner and stay there.'Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: Maybe I just need to get used to it.
Reviews.Author: Suz
Reviews.Content: Tip for the clueless, like me:  When I first got this camera, I almost returned it because the images through the viewfinder looked very blurry.  Turns out I just needed to adjust the diopter, the little dial to the left of the viewfinder.The SX20 IS seems a little heavy and bulky.  I'm not sure how much I'll enjoy taking it along on all-day excursions.  On the plus side, it eliminates the need for an additional camcorder.  There is no good place to store the lens cap.  I lost it the first day after attaching it to the strap.  I'm going to replace it with one that has a leash.  I keep getting the button for the video and the on/off button confused, filming video instead of turning off the camera, but I'm sure I'll get used to it in time.  The SX20 IS is much better than my old Camedia at lag time between depressing the button and the shutter going off, but it is still an issue with action and candid shots.When I downloaded the first couple dozen pictures I took, all taken on auto, I was disappointed that they were markedly less sharp than those of my Camedia, which my daughter used the same day under the same conditions.  Judging by the remarkably clear photos on the customer images, though, I figure I must just need to play with the settings some. The image stabilization worked well.  My pictures taken from a car traveling 55 MPH came out with no blur, as did pictures taken with almost full zoom.At this point (about 5 days), the jury is still out.  I'm saving all paperwork and keeping my receipt handy until I have the opportunity to mess with it more and take more pictures.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed by the SX20IS!
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: *Update: Canon is releasing a SX30 IS! Unfortunately, it is loaded but does not support RAW or superfine jpeg mode. Why? I can't imagine! If they had included at least the superfine jpeg I may have tried the updated version as the camera has a ton of features and out of this world zoom!I really wanted to like this camera as I was hoping it would be a good bridge camera when I didn't want to drag my DSLR around. But, autofocus was indecisive/slow and the quality of the pictures was simply not good. There is no super fine compression/quality setting, only fine and normal, which leaves much to be desired in clarity, sharpness and low noise prints - even 4x6! You must lift the flash even in auto mode, and I was not able to ever make the flash engage even with changing every setting under the sun! Just by pulling it up didn't work (per the manual). There was no simple way to engage fill flash or flash for low light settings - sure, I could have gone to manual mode and compensated with exposure settings... but, is the average person going to do this? This is a nearly $400 camera - it should take nice, clear pictures in auto! If you are a fan of burst mode or want it for action shots, this camera will not perform well under those circumstances (1 shot per second is not fast, nor considered burst mode). The articulating LCD screen though is very nice and one of the reasons I purchased it. The HD video is also great though watch your settings, because the highest setting has lower frame per second rates and could end up looking choppy with/without a tripod). Also, keep in mind, you cannot use a filter without first purchasing a converter (not from Canon, they don't make them) and then buy a filter - then if you want a hood you will need to purchase a different one as your original will no longer fit.This could have been a great camera, as it has many great features, range and creative controls (no supported RAW though), but without good quality pictures it does not live up to the Canon name/quality for the price! (Maybe I got a bad one?) Anyway, as much as I wanted to keep it and continue working with it (the majority of reviews are great), I decided instead to buy a new walk around lense for my Canon T2i and just use that as I am almost always pleased with the outcome - great pictures! Disappointed though in the Canon SX20IS, as I have always been a big Canon fan! Well, I still am - but Canon needs to work out some of these problems with the SX20IS before I will look at it again.

Reviews.Title: Slightly disappointing
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Sprang
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Rebel T1i for my girlfriend and even with that SLR experience under her belt she had a difficult time setting this camera up to take decent quick pictures for my sister. I love Canon products but I am sorely disappointed with this one. This was supposed to be a step up from a point and shoot and a step down from an SLR but I would much rather use my point and shoot than this much more expensive camera. It does take very good pictures with just the right setting but only about 1 in 7 pictures seemed to turn out well. On the plus side I ordered 2 day shipping but it came in about 5. Without me contacting anyone I received a refund for the entire shipping fee.

Reviews.Title: Powerful "bridge" camera
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos Giron Palomo
Reviews.Content: My first "bridge" camera and I'm very pleased with the results. Like the manual mode since I wanted to move from a full auto Kodak P&S; but not yet ready for a DSLR with all the lenses and stuff. Let me start by saying I'm not a pro but as others have already commented, if you expect this camera to take wonderful or amazing shots and all you use is AUTO mode this is not the right camera. IMHO will be a waste to use this in AUTO mode since it was built for a lot more than that.Powerful zoom, friendly user menu screens, easy access to most frequent settings (when you get used to it). I separately purchased the filter adapter from Lensmate and have now the option to use UV and polarizing filters on it. To save a couple of bucks I ordered some chinese manual flashes and they work just great with this camera. I also purchased a Cactus V4 set for wireless flash photography and have had no problems at all.Bottom line: this camera will allow you to explore your creative side using the manual settings and powerful zoom with nice quality pictures after spending enough time reading the manual and getting used to it but in the other hand will disappoint you if all you do is use AUTO mode or expect "$1500-pro-camera" photos just by using it out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Debi Whitman
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've bought this camera--only because I gave the first one to my son then realized how much I missed having this camera.  Easy to operate, easy to learn.  And the pictures come out great too.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: Nicole Bryerton
Reviews.Content: I have tried the SX30IS and came back to this one. I love everything about it. Especially the long zoom.

Reviews.Title: sx20 is fixes
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Mathis
Reviews.Content: For all of you folks who have been having focus or soft picture quality issues with your sx20 is cameras; there are now ways to enhance your cameras including the ability to save your pictures in RAW format!  I now love this camera due to the fixes found at the CHDK Wiki site found on line.  Just google it. CHDK stands for Canon Developers Hackers Kit and it provides a nondestructive means to restore lost functionality to this camera.  My sx20 is is now capable of ISO down to 30.  I can now save my pictures in RAW format and the SUPERFINE JPEG format has been restored.  Other treats include 1 minute exposures down to 1/68thousandth of a second(captures waterdrops)...a whole line of focal lenth calculators, zebramodes and histogram enhancements. ISO and F stop adjustments, Camera auto settings adjustments are available as well as augmented hyperfocal super macro settings.  Available scripts that allow motion trigger photo capture(read:lightning bolts and nocturnal animal shots) and computer remote photography is again available.  Adjustments to camera shake sensitivities are available. Fine adjustments to the flash are also available plus a whole lot more.  The sx20is electronics have so many capablities built into them but are kept locked away by sales considerations not actual machanical limits!  The software augments but does not rewrite firmware so when you replace the sd chip with chdk software on it with a blank, the camera firmware has not been touched or rewritten. The cdhk software acts as kind of a operating system that makes uses of Canon settings as well as its own.  So try the CHDK WIKI site before chucking your sx20is into the drink.PS.  For those who hated the soft focus of the so called (auto settings), but are afraid of trying the raw DNG format, the restored superfine jpeg settings should give you that sharpness you are looking for

Reviews.Title: Good camera with some faults
Reviews.Author: Matthew Peterson "ChevelleSSLS6"
Reviews.Content: Good:Quality construction far beyond most-all 'point and shoot' cameras.Zoom for not being a SLRBattery Life (Sanyo rechargeable AAs off Amazon)It takes AAs, not some goofy proprietary battery so if you have 'deads' you can swing by any store and get some batteries in a snap.Daytime picture qualityLots of neat scene modes, color switch and color accent is really great.Adjustable angle for screen, even works for 'myspace mugshot' type pictures.Adjustable focus for viewfinder (yes the old school camera style viewfinder)Bad:Screen can be a tad small (if it didn't need a frame and hinge so it can fold out, they could have done it)Long exposure night shots get 'noisy'.  Too bad they couldn't have put a SLR light sensor in it for noise-free night shots.Can't figure out how to 'time' the flash so night images 'blur' into focus (think National Geographic pictures, usually of traffic is a good example of this)Kind of big for a point-n-shoot (then again, it's easily worth it with all the zoom and features.  If you want portability, use a small point-n-shoot camera).

Reviews.Title: Thrilled with SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Arrowcatcher
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent super-zoom camera.  I've had other models by Sony and Olympus, but this Canon is in another league entirely.  In particular the lens quality is excellent, and the image stabilization is extremely effective.  The detail in distant telephoto shots is amazing, especially as compared to the former similar cameras I've owned.  Compared with my former super-zooms, there is also much less issue with chromatic aberration.  Really superb lens.The significant note I make is that anyone buying and using a DSLR or a camera such as the SX20IS with copious setup choices must really experiment with those various settings to make the camera function optimally the way they use it.  I took dozens of images in a variety of conditions and tinkered until I found the best settings for me.  It really makes a huge difference. Simply using Automatic doesn't cut it, and I'm so glad that Canon has engineered so many operational choices into the camera.  Customizing the camera setup greatly increased my satisfaction with it.Although it may be controversial, I'm pleased to use the "i-Contrast" dynamic range extender.  It works out great for me. While the exposure balance across an image may sometimes turn out noticeably unnatural, it has been far easier to correct for that later as opposed to my manually bringing out detail in selected excessively dark areas in a normally exposed picture.  The i-Contrast has turned out to be my favorite extra feature.  Dynamic range is a most important ongoing issue in photography, and this little tool provides major useful assistance with that.The video works well too.  I've been more interested in stills, but I'm using the handy video function more and more frequently.  For me this is clearly a 5 star camera.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I have ever had.
Reviews.Author: Mr. S. Moss
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera yet. I always use canon products. The video is better than camcorders. Took back a sony POS camcorder. This one smokes it in video. Pictures are awesome. Features are more than enough for anyone. Even professional use this camera will out perform your needs and expectation.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Video Quality!!
Reviews.Author: Tanzy
Reviews.Content: I am very thrilled with this camera!  I was torn between buying an individual video camera or a digital/video combination.  My friend had the older version of this camera and suggested it and I am so glad she did.  I am amazed by the quality of the video that it takes even in low light conditions.  On my old camera the video would be so dark you could not see anything.  If you are interested in a digital camera that takes great stills AND amazing video then I highly recommend this camera.  The only drawback is if you are wanting to film long videos. I believe the maximum is about 25 minutes of record time.  Personally I like making shorter vids anyway so 25 minutes is more than enough to meet my needs.  I was also very pleased by how easy this camera is to use.  Bottom line:  I LOVE this camera and can't wait to take more pictures and video!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the beginner or an avid photographer
Reviews.Author: J. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a month and I love it.  Takes great video, pictures for landscaping come out awesome.  I really like the style and the easyness of use.  When you change settings, it tells you what setting you are on.  I have yet to change the batteries which is nice.  Great zoom.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for an amateur
Reviews.Author: T. Dietrich
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace our 6 year old cannon powershot A80.  After doing extensive research and consulting 'Consumer Reports' I decided on this model.  I waited for nearly a year and watched the prices fluctuate as well as kept up with the research in case another camera came on the market that was better.  I am thrilled with the quality of the pictures and video and am so excited that I can actually shoot pictures of my small children that actually catches them in the act instead of missing a special moment due to slowness.  Of course this is NOT a DSLR which would have a faster shutter speed, etc., but it is a quality piece of equipment for which you can't go wrong.I also bought a Transcend 8GB class 6 SDHC memory card and a LowePro Apex 110 bag, both of which are perfect as well!  Very satisfied and all items shipped fast.

Reviews.Title: Just Okay
Reviews.Author: McFran
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my and my daughter's first trip to Florida.  I was impressed at first with its zooming capabilities which were primarily what attracted this camera to me in the first place but, after using it, discovered that the pictures rarely came out clear.  Most were grainy or just plain blurry.  They looked fine on the screen but when I viewed them on my computer, it was evident that very few of the pictures I took came out good enough to print out, much less keep.  That was very disappointing considering why we take pictures in the first place.If you have the time, patience, and ability to take pictures with a tripod and possibly use the manual focus options to get your aim and shot "just right," this camera might be for you.  However; if you are looking for a great "point and shoot" camera that takes decent photos in regular situations, you'd be better off with something more user-friendly and basic.  I typically take between 1200-1400 pictures during a week-long vacation (of which between 400-500 are excellent quality) and this camera gave me only about 40 good, usable photographs.  I'm going back to my inexpensive camera which takes much better pictures.

Reviews.Title: No better than SX110 / SX120
Reviews.Author: D. Ralphs "exercise heals, narcotics kill"
Reviews.Content: I've bought a new digital camera every year or two since '98. Canon has great cameras. I got a SX110IS over a year ago, and it's a great camera, but I'm always willing to upgrade. The SX110 is rated at 10x optical zoom, 6-60, and 9.0 mp. The SX20 is rated at 20x optical zoom, 5-100, and 12.1 mp; it's gotta be better, right? I took a bunch of pix with both cameras side by side with the same settings in several locations, and I could not appreciate any better quality from the SX 20. The difference in zoom was not a big deal, it really did not seem to have 2x the zoom. The pictures with the 110 were actually bigger data files. The 110 takes images up to 3456 x 2592, and the SX20 takes images up to 3264 x 2448. Why does the 12.1mp camera take smaller pictures with less data than the 9.0mp camera? Either one is way overkill for viewing on a monitor, but if you want to crop the pix down, you want to start with a bigger image and bigger data file. The 110 takes as good as or better pix, has bigger data files, uses 2 AA batteries versus 4, and fits in a pocket. The SX20 is just big enough to make you hesitate to bring it along all the time. No matter how nice your camera, if you don't have it with you, you don't get any pictures.  The newer version of the 110 is the 120, which is rated at 10mp with the same 10x zoom. The 120 takes images up to 3648 x 2738, another step larger than the SX20 images, and it cost around $230 VS the SX20 at around $360. The 120 has a 3" screen VS a 2.5 on the SX20. The image sensors, which are the true determinant of what you get for an image are almost exactly the same size. The 120 is 1/2.5, and the SX20 is just slightly bigger at 1/2.3, but again, the resolution on the SX20 is smaller, and the data file is smaller. I almost never return purchases but I sent the SX20 back. I already have a few perfectly good, old cameras sitting on the shelf. The only feature the SX20 has over the 120 is the articulating screen. On my 2nd and 3rd digital cameras I thought that was an important feature, but anymore it really doesn't matter for the pix I take. If you have small kids the moving screen will help you get pictures at their level. Otherwise, go for the smaller, cheaper, better SX120.The shutter to shutter speed might be slightly better with the SX20 since it has 4 batteries, but neither of these has a burst mode. I did not find the SX20 to be notably faster, which was something I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Lawrence E. Asmussen
Reviews.Content: I hope to get a lot of use of this camera.  It is still a little too early to tell, but with an upcomming family get together in Florida we will find out.  For me the biggest disapointment is no detailed instruction book.  Unfortunately I'm not a computer buff carrying a portable laptop to read the instruction from the disc.  Maybe somebody knows a source for an instruction book.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bobbie J.
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything I was looking for. Easy to use and the zoom is superb.I have enjoyed it very much. The sport mode is great for pictures of my grandkids during their sport events. Can't wait to take it on vacation in May. I'm sure to get some great shots.

Reviews.Title: Learning this jewel will be an Odyssey--but so far so good.
Reviews.Author: Blimey "Blimey"
Reviews.Content: This is a shallow review because I have only had the camera a few weeks, but so far no disappointments.  It's so complex that it will take awhile to really learn to use it, but so far it's as advertised.  I was relieved to see that it not only incorporates one of the best super-long telephotos (20X), it retains the super-macro closeup feature.  I may add to this review later when I'm more knowledgeable--but as of now I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.  I've found Canon to be tops in digital photography.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershoy SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Camera is fantastic, incredible zoom and wide angle features. I have other Canon cameras as well as Canon products. The price was great and the shipping was fast. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: So far Great camera for the most part
Reviews.Author: M. Orbke "Mom of  3"
Reviews.Content: This camera so far has been taking very good pictures & we are enjoying it.It has a lot of very cool features on it not to mention the HD video!The only thing so far I don't like about it is that unless you & the object/person you are taking a picture of are very still, then it comes out fuzzy & blurry. I don't quite understand the "image stabilization" feature, when most images aren't stabilized, but this camera is very NEW to us, so I know I still need to read up & practice more with it to know more about it.It is a good quality camera, & takes very good pics, when done right.I wish it took faster pics. There is a mode that does take faster pics, but again when I use it, most pics come out blurry, so to give this camera an even better review I need to practice & use it more.I would recommend this camera to others. It has a lot of great features!If you just want a simple camera, though-this camera is NOT for you.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for its class
Reviews.Author: Mark Hampton
Reviews.Content: We got this to reignite my wife's photography passion from the old days of film. We were very impressed with the zoom, the fully articulated screen, and the video. We ultimately were disappointed in the lack of RAW support and the final product when zoomed into 100% on a large screen. I believe this camera would be great for a family wanting to take really good family event photos while retaining the ability to take quick videos as well without carrying around multiple devices. For an artist with an eye for composition, focus, clarity, and control, this camera didn't do the job. We tried to compromise her photography desire with my video bug and ended up with a camera that didn't do either one to our satisfaction. So the camera went back and we selected and entry level dslr from canon instead.

Reviews.Title: Replaced a stolen SX10IS
Reviews.Author: S. W. Day
Reviews.Content: I had and loved a SX10IS. Loved that camera,but it was stolen. I got this to replace it. Mostly love the features. And the HD video is a big plus. Only annoyances are: Canon does not have a method to attach a filter (I use a polarizer outside, but lensmate makes an adapter that works fine.). Autofocus goes crazy when shooting video, if you pan it is always trying to focus on something as you move. I just go to manual focus. No RF or IR remote offered, you have to touch the shutter on the camera or set self timer..

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: C. King
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a month, so I am not totally use to using it yet. I like the camera and with basic pictures I am doing OK.  The book that comes with the camera gives only basics and when I try to view the "book on CD" on my computer I have difficulty because you cannot just turn pages.  You have to know what you are looking for and type in specifics in order to get an answer.  You do not always know what to type in.  The camera really needs a book WITH the product or the option to get one from Canon at no additional cost.The camera has a video button that allows you to video no matter what mode you have the camera set at.  You can also zoom while in video mode, which I was not able to do with my previous camera.  Nice feature.

Reviews.Title: I love Canon
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: I previously owned a Canon Powershot A630, but then my son dropped it and the zoom busted and I was without a camera.  I wanted to just replace my old Canon because I loved that camera and it worked well for me.  I just take pictures of family and outdoor stuff. I'm not doing this professionally or even really as a hobby. I just want good pics of my family and their activities.  So I tried to locate the A630, but Amazon wanted $70 more than what I paid for it 3 years ago.  NO.  So I found this camera at another store and looked at it before I bought it online.  It had the flip screen which  I love for taking different angled shots.  It had all the same buttons like portrait, custom color, color swap, indoors, foliage, fireworks, underwater, etc.  The zoom is amazing on this camera and I love that it isn't extremely huge.  I can still handle it pretty well.  The lens cap is kind of cheap, but it works.  I still have yet to mess with the camera and figure it all out, but I am so pleased with this camera.  I have been able to figure out the majority of the buttons because I already owned a Canon previously.  I just love Canon's.  They work well for someone like me who is looking for good quality family shots although I think its way better than a basic point and shoot camera.  The price also was a good buy.  The store wanted $50 more than Amazon did.  I think this is a really great camera.  You'll be pleased.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Eileen Herman "FitnessBabe"
Reviews.Content: This camera is spectacular!  It is so easy to use, takes the absolute best pictures and it's super fun to use.  I've read people complaining about the lens cap, it clicks on fine, no problems.  The flash works great, if you want more light in low light conditions, buy another flash.  The fact that I can record video and then take pictures and zoom in while recording is terrific, I've used that a lot.  My favorite camera, I LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: My son LOVES it!
Reviews.Author: Audrey Furst
Reviews.Content: I have the same camera. My son was always taking mine so I decided to buy him one of his own. He absolutely loves it.It arrived in great condition, and earlier than I expected.  Thank you for being so prompt. I very much appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: LCD screen problem in SX20IS
Reviews.Author: George L. Danielewski
Reviews.Content: The LCD screen problem.After 10 months the LCD screen started to work only in custom mode.  Why?GeorgePenndel, Pa

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Lu
Reviews.Content: This is a nice point and shoot camera.  It takes good video and has enough functions for a step down from a true DSLR.  The biggest drawbacks are the limitations of the lens.  Anything in the macro ranges are fuzzy, shakey, and sometimes fail completely.  But It has taken some amazing long-range shots.

Reviews.Title: Haven't Received It Yet!
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera Dec 3d and have yet to receive it. I've always received my merchandises within a week when I order through Amazon. We're on week two and I keep getting different delivery dates. The days come, and nothing. The money was taken out immediately and I've been left hanging without this Christmas gift from my husband.

Reviews.Title: Looking for an alternative to the big expensive cameras?
Reviews.Author: Robert G. Siefker "Boiler Maker Bob"
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera for several years and bought a used one to replace my old one when the flip out display died.This camera has many features which I love - 20X optical zoom, Image Stabilization, etc. But the flip out display is the top thing I love! The LCD display on the back flips out and rotates around. You can shoot over crowds, ceilings, selfies, etc. Plus, this is the last Canon that runs off 4 AA batteries. I get 4-6  hours out of a single set of rechargeable batteries.  Looking for an alternative to the big expensive cameras?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: HARLAN G. Broers
Reviews.Content: Great camera , great range used for 16 days in Germany, wide angle gave great views so did the zoom

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Ivy Sievers
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and feel 99% of the function deserves a 5 star rating but I feel a design change would be important to make and that is the position of the off and one button.  When you set up your shots it is really easy to accidentally turn off your camera because the actual shutter button is the furtherest away. Even tho the buttons are different colors and sizes, it's still an issue with me. It is a big deal when you're in a hurry to grab the shot.  This camera is the in between of a little point and shoot and a SLR (which I also have).  I love it as I have the choice of an eye piece or LED screen that pivots out to capture the photos at arms length (this is also where the shutter button should be closer to the hands ability to press it.  I am a lefty my husband a right and we have the same opinion of that shutter button location.

Reviews.Title: Great blending of point and shoot and SLR
Reviews.Author: Pat Viamonte
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera with better zoom and more options than my basic one. I especially like the viewfinder, which with my nearsightedness is so much better to use. Also like the choice of using it as an automatic point and shoot or allowing me to make changes as I learn more.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the money but spend a little more and get a better one.
Reviews.Author: bducman
Reviews.Content: The camera is OK. Works fine and does decent pictures. But the picture quality is not was I expected from a Canon product. My old Olympus took better pictures, and this is just sad.

Reviews.Title: great for video and still pics
Reviews.Author: Rondal L. Harrington
Reviews.Content: excellent for use I wanted, pictures could be a little sharper and a little slow between shots if picture review is turned on, if off recovery time is much quicker. Zoom power is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: DISPOSABLE CANON CAMERA POWERSHOR SX201S
Reviews.Author: J. Cruz "Ricardo"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in 2010 for $ 350 aprox (selling price) from Amazon.  Beg of this year 2013, I started having problems with the zoom, I started to get the message "reset camera" and the zoom would go crazy, it does not even allow me to shut it down.  Anyway, while it lasted, the camera was great!  I gave it a one star because I would not consider CANON cameras to be disposable, they should outlast the new models and still keep up and running.  Due to this problem I will not conisder a new CANON camera, I will try a different brand, as I'm very very disapointed.  The local suppliers told me that changing the zoom is more expensive than buying a new camera and since it has been almost 3 years since I bought it, the guarantee has expired.  To my surprise now Amazon is selling the camera at $ 600 that is almost double the cost I paid 3 years ago for a disposable camera.  I sincerely DO NOT recommend this product anymore

Reviews.Title: long time owner
Reviews.Author: photospammer
Reviews.Content: I've been having mine for at least 3 years and never had any problems with it. It takes AA batteries so its easy to replace them when they die and you're on a mountain trail somewhere. I recommend 8 rechargeable batteries and a battery charger for people who don't mind charging them. It saves plenty of money in the long run. I started out using mine for college in photography and the teacher ALWAYS loved the way my pictures came out. I was a bit worried a few days ago for the first time when we got caught in pouring rain on a trail with no cover because I had no where to put my camera so it literally had plenty water running on it and through it (mainly the lens mechanics area which is probably the worst place it could get to). So when we got back I patted it down with a towel and put it in a plastic bag but forgot it in my car sitting in the condensation of the water I missed. Obviously it didn't work when I tried messing with it the next day but the battery area and the memory card area are both tight seals so they were perfectly dry and worked perfect. So I put it in my camera bag with the lens cap off and it not touching the wet strap thinking that I'd have to buy another one when I got home. Two days have passed, I took out my camera to see about the strap. I got curious and turned it on and it works PERFECTLY! This camera is extremely sturdy (though I don't recommend you try hurting it). It's an amazing camera for people who would like to take nice pictures in almost any lighting without needing too big of a camera like the really serious professionals have. The flip out screen makes it easy to get the perfect picture at any angle and works perfect with the timers for a group picture. Seriously a great buy!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERQA.
Reviews.Author: April kid "aprilkid"
Reviews.Content: Good camera but it had an issue that it had to be returned. Amazon provided a full refund. Otherwise is a really good camera for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: Still love it!
Reviews.Author: camera buff "camera buff"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for several years and still love it.  I take mostly pictures of my dogs and such and I find the pictures very nice, the color great and the camera easy to use.  I love the screen that moves because I often am trying to get a picture of a dog on the ground and don't want to get on the ground with them so I can simply adjust the screen.I honestly mostly shoot in "auto" mode since it works so well.  If I had a DLSR, then I might do more, like I did with my old film camera's, but with the auto doing such a good job, I just leave it.I tend to agree that the flash is not great.  I even bought an external flash and I don't care for the way the pictures turn out with that either.  However, I take a lot of low light pictures and they turn out OKThe unexpected plus for me was the video. I honestly thought I would never use the video so I didn't care much for it.  I found out that it is super easy to use, and takes good video.  I compete in agility with my dogs and use it all the time to take video of my runs and friends' runs.  The zoom is a little fast at times, but for not expecting to use it at all, I can deal with that.As far as the software, I had Adobe photoshop but lost it when my computer crashed.  I now simply copy and paste from the SD card and everything works great.  I suppose I could try to find my disk with the software somewhere and use that but for now, it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: G. Brooks
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a trip to Alaska and caught some outstanding shots using the excellent zoom. It is a bit bulky (so 4 stars not 5) but that is partly due to the fact that it uses 4 AA batteries, so you can get emergency power anywhere. It's really easy to  use, and has good auto as well as manual controls. In spite of its size, it has become my grab-and-go camera.

Reviews.Title: Great price, does the job.
Reviews.Author: Mary Katherine Bush
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this camera. He takes it outdoors to film his rock climbing videos for YouTube. He loves the HD quality and especially the flip screen.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kyndle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera used from a seller here on Amazon.com and so far I am beyond happy with the camera. It's very easy to use, and I would suggest it to anyone who wants to start getting into photography and wants to get a cheap beginners camera or just the average person just wanting decent vacation pictures! The 20x optical zoom is amazing! For those who don't know, that is the maximum distance the camera can zoom without losing image quality. The articulating LCD screen is also a very neat feature, it's extremely helpful being able to fold the screen in when not in use to protect it from scratches. I think this camera's strongest point is it's macro shots. Taking close up shots of flowers and other things have turned out amazing. It's macro and super macro settings are where this camera takes its best pictures. So whether or not you just want an inexpensive camera to take decent pictures when you go on vacation or you want to just start getting a feel for photography I'd say this is a great camera. I probably would even recommend this to avid photographers who just want a much lighter camera that takes good pictures to lug around instead of a heavy and big digital SLR. Overall, very happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: RAW
Reviews.Author: raymar
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA TAKES SUCH GOOD PICTURES BUT MY WIFE HATES IT BECAUSE YOU CAN SEE EVERY ONE OF HER NOSE AND MUSTACHE HAIRS.

Reviews.Title: Great priced camera that does video well
Reviews.Author: William Markowski
Reviews.Content: I use this camera mostly to shoot HD video. The powerful zoom is great, you need a tripod or other device to hold it steady though. Not the cameras fault.

Reviews.Title: Nice Product
Reviews.Author: Derrick B
Reviews.Content: I got a nice camera at a nice price & I got it quickly, i will buy more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous
Reviews.Author: Heather Jarvis
Reviews.Content: One of best cameras I've ever owned.  Has even been accidentally dropped and still works perfectly.  Love love love love!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot sx20is
Reviews.Author: Michelle Valentin "michiev7777"
Reviews.Content: The camera is fine I think it needed the extra colors.I had to put through to photo shop and enhance thecolors.

Reviews.Title: Legacy continues
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: Canon has been steadily progressing the generation of the point and shoot cameras. I've bought all the cameras in this line - 10IS, 20IS, 30IS, 40IS and now 50IS either for myself or as a gift. Every time, it has increased my confidence on the Canon product line.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Veniamin Brukh
Reviews.Content: This is a good product and very good price that I can find on internet. I recommend to others this product.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Marcin Szuba
Reviews.Content: I use it for 2 years and still sometimes I get surprised by the possibilities of the camera. Good value for money, perfect for an amateur who wants to start taking photos using more and more complicated settings.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Roberta Wanyo
Reviews.Content: This camera has traveled with us on every vacation.  The quality of the pictures are fantastic and the size is just perfect for traveling.

Reviews.Title: Great World Traveling Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Ball
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera when it first came out to take with me as I traveled for work around the world. I wanted a camera that would take great shots but not have the weight and bulk of DSLR cameras and their multitude of lenses. This camera has not let me down. It has traveled with me from China to Korea to Uzbekistan taking amazing landscape photos and great people photos. It is quick and I have had several people comment on my pictures wondering what type of camera and lens combination I am using. It is still going strong to this day. One thing I have noticed - once in a while - a very very small part of the time - the focus won't work. Not sure why but I just turn the camera on and off for that 1 in 1000 times and the camera is back at it. If I was able to change one thing on this camera it would be the frame per second - I like taking sports shots and I would like this camera to be able to take more pictures (frames) per second. This is a minor limitation of the camera. I thought getting a faster memory card would help - but it made no difference. You can have the fastest card on the planet but if the camera does not write to it quick enough...This is a point and shoot camera with enough bells and whistles to play around with when you want to try different things. When I have pushed it to the limits - Chicago skyline at night, shooting from a moving car in Uzbekistan, this camera has responded very well.Is it a professional camera - no - but it has to be pretty close for what the majority of intermediate users would use it for.While I would like to go to a Canon T4i and get more involved with photography - I can't justify the replacing this camera as it works so well for what I need. So until this camera dies I will be happily snapping away and enjoying hanging my pictures on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Most Non Heinous
Reviews.Author: HanaRella
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. The quality of the pics is awesome. The automatic is the only setting i use! it is still working great after......well, over 2 years. A friend of mine asked me how much it cost and was surprised at how cheap it was, considering how awesome it is. About a month ago it started showing what looked like a little smudge on the lens, not very easy to see, but i was afraid it would get darker, (mom has a very cheap canon that got a dark blotch on it's lens) but it's gone now, and the pics are as good as ever. oh yeah, and the colors are amazing! but when i load the pics onto my computer their colors lose their brilliance; just tune them up a bit using picasa, and there ya go. Zoom is awesome.....videos are awesome. And that pop out screen? couldn't live without it!

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: Justin&Briana;
Reviews.Content: Best camera for the non professional photographer. Very easy to use. The next step up is the SLR cameras. Much better photos then the nikon. Not as yellow as nikon.

Reviews.Title: Meets my amateur needs
Reviews.Author: Odn "Odn"
Reviews.Content: I have a few dealbreakers when choosing a camera: (1) Digital (2) Must have Optical and Screen Viewfinders (3) Must use batteries I can purchase without having to get to an electrical outlet for a recharge (4)must have zoom of at least 15X.  This camera fits all 4.  As for the quality, the pictures are nice, equal to my Coolpix P60 at the least (it covers dealbreakers 1-3). In macro mode it takes unreal closeups.  HD takes a lot of space but the VGA is good quality as well.  It has a nice, solid, professional look and feel.For a snapshot shooter like myself, I think it's a pretty awesome camera for the price. I did SLRs in the 60s &  70s; personally I think they're a pain.It seems I still use my P60 all the time, though.  It's just easier to lug around and I don't worry about it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: GadgetFreak
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a successor to the PowerShot S3 IS, and the improvements were worthwhile. The upgrade to 12.1MP over the 6MP of the S3, combined with the additional range on the zoom make a huge difference at the long end. The lens is fast enough in low light to capture some long-range zoomed images of birds in the relatively darkness of the tropical rainforest. While substantially larger and heavier than a point-and-shot camera, the SX20IS is smaller and lighter than a DSLR. While the photo quality is compromised compared to a DSLR, if you are not a professional, or a dedicated photography hobbyist, you will be happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for beginners and perfect for all occasions
Reviews.Author: DSM
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for one of my friends.Pros: The picture quality is really nice. Camera operation is so simple and 20x zoom puts you really into the middle of the action. Camera grip is nice, buttons are located at perfect locations. vari-Angle LCD panel gives you much more flexibility in choosing the shooting angles.Cons: The regular complaint every one makes about Canon, the batteries. I don't understand why they are stuck in alkaline era and why can't adopt Li-ion technology. This is really annoying.

Reviews.Title: Great for filming your own exercises
Reviews.Author: Tropical Bill
Reviews.Content: I picked the camera for its quality and for its articulated screen that allows me to set it to video graph myself doing exercises. A minor complaint is that it does not have a cable release.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my father
Reviews.Author: Felix Foret
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my digital camera challenge father. The camera takes great pictures and videos. It just needs to be a little easier for the older generation. I did not like the way you could turn off the LCD on the back or the view finder. Other than that it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: The major issue i have with this camera is the lens cap does not stay on and I ended up scratching the lens.  So, now I have a scratched lens and the auto focus really gets confused - but even with these issues - the photos are fantastic.  I am not a professional, just like the zoom and the ability to take nice, crisp photos.  Great work, cannon.  Two other people have borrowed this camera and have since purchased one becase of the wonderful zoom and great photos clarity.  I will just need to save upsome more $$ to buy myself a new one that isn't scratched.  :)

Reviews.Title: best for powershot
Reviews.Author: chandubabu
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for an year, I am not a professional photographer, but this camera has grown my interest in photography even more, some of the plus points about this camera, even if you zoom to a long distance, as long as you keep your hands steady or use a tripod, the image quality will still be great unlike few other cameras  who offer good zoom but when you increase the zoom the quality of the image gets deteriorated. I also love its image quality for photos taken at night. Try experimenting with its vivid colors, sepia and black and white mode, and of course the fireworks, they are amazing.  it is little heavy but if you wear it around your neck or use a tripod you can take perfect photos, right now I am using  it's manual mode and will switch over to an SLR after a year or two, but this will always be my first love. I checked out the SX30is, did not like it as much as this one. Only thing I wish it had rechargeable Li ion battery like my another cannon rather than the AA batteries. So far I would say with my 1 year experience with this camera, this is the best one can have as a powershot if you want better than this will have to aim for an SLR .

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: spmarg
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  Good vendor.  Lens cap is a pain in the neck. Keeps falling off.  Poor system.  Overall, pleased.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: William Esch "Bill Esch"
Reviews.Content: As an "Old School" 35mm film camera user -- I cut my teeth on a Canon AE1 -- this camera was a great choice for my first, entry-level digital camera.  I received it just days before a trip to Disney World.  Managed to take hundreds of pictures and all of them are great.  One reason I purchased this camera was because it has an viewfinder like my AE1.  I can't stand watching people hold their camera 12 inches away from there face and I won't do that.  This camera is fairly easy to use. I just wish the zoom was manual cause I think I could zoom more the way I can it quicker and better without depending on the mechanics of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: Over all takes very good to excellent pictures and video.  Please keep in mind that takes video in MOV mode and must be converted to AVI mode to watch on dvd player with TV, when making a disc.  MOV mode is apparently related to Apple.  I am not a computer savvy so this causes a mild headache for me.  Low light sometimes leads to some poorer picture quality for me.  But feel as I learn more about the camera I will solve most of that problem.  Instruction booklet needs to redone with more instructions.  Camera has more functions than booklet lets one to believe.  Glad friend had earlier model and able to show me more about what camera can do. Zoom is good, but very quick. Focus with Zoom is very good. My friends earlier model would not focus automatically when zoomed, while this one does. Would recommend camera for someone who wants a very good camera for this price range.  Be prepared to call Canon for more instructions as to use, unless you already are very savvy with cameras already.  This one was a big upgrade for me.  My last digital camera was over five years ago.  And as I implied earlier, I am not happy that is in MOV video mode.

Reviews.Title: Great step up from a standard digital camera!
Reviews.Author: hmrice
Reviews.Content: When a friend of mine asked me to take photos of her wedding I decided it was time for a new camera. I was looking for a step up from my regular digital camera that would give me a higher quality photos without needing to take a course on how to use the camera and without spending tons of money. The auto functions works well and after some practice I am learning how to use the additional features and manual settings quite well. The difference in picture quality between this and my previous point and shoot digital camera is amazing! I would recommend this camera to anyone who is interested in amatuer photography, or for a professional photographer looking for a portable camera to carry with them.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Rui
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an intermediate step before having a professional.I can point out that it has an excellent zoom, is very useful articulated screen, and has a lot of options to get the best photography.It is important to have a good knowledge of the functions to get good images.The size is good for moving it.I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Clarification -
Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: The camera produces pictures and video of very high quality - it's 2 cameras in 1 at a reasonable price.The camera DOES have a 52mm thread for filters and other accesories, but, it is very finely milled, and I've found it may be difficult to get older close-up rings, slide copiers, etc. to go on smoothly.The camera does have quite a few internal features that give the photographer similar control, ie, contrast, nd, and different color,tint and light balance or compensation among many other controls. I've been using Tiffen Filters' Software package in lieu of spending $1000 on new hd accesories. (But most of my filters from the last decade or so seem to work fine).

Reviews.Title: Lens Cap Woes....
Reviews.Author: S. Coleman "Grandma Sue"
Reviews.Content: This Canon camera has good features and is definitely an upgrade from the tiny point & shoot camera I have been using but I do have a few issues with it.  I think the lens cap should have a cord attaching it to the camera so it won't get lost, misplaced or fall off.  It has a clip on the back of it to clip it onto the neck strap but when I tried that - it got knocked off and I almost lost it.The zoom feature, located on the button for taking pictures is slow to react so it takes a moment to adjust & I have lost a few shots because of the delay.  The pictures are crisp & clear though and it is a fair camera for the money.  It's a stepping stone for me.......

Reviews.Title: Excellent out of box, very good customer service
Reviews.Author: Carol006
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time looking at cameras and reviews at Amazon and elsewhere before I decided on the SX20 IS. I wanted excellent quality pictures and wide angle capability so I could take pictures of the Grand Canyon on my vacation. I didn't have much time to learn the camera before the trip, so having a camera that was easy to use--and that performed well on "auto"--was important to me. I also wanted a camera I could grow into, one that offered a lot of manual settings that I could learn how to use later on. I was impressed that the Canon SX20 IS could accomodate a polaroid filter. (A filter adaptor ring for this camera is sold by Lensmate at[...] This was also one of the few cameras available in this category with both a viewfinder and LCD screen. The heft of the camera and the size of the controls were pluses as well, since my husband and I both have large hands. I was very pleased with the pictures I took (mostly with the "auto" feature) as well as the videos. I was also impressed with Canon's customer service . I needed help on two occasions for "problems" that required more knowledge of the camera than I had when I called customer service. Both times I was able to reach a customer service representative quickly, and got the help I needed. What I wish I would have known ahead of time: a camera in the "travel camera" category would not have had the features I wanted, but it would have been a little easier to lug on hikes.

Reviews.Title: SX20
Reviews.Author: C. Peterson
Reviews.Content: I have only had the camera for a short time. It is an everyday camera for me. I have had an XTI for three years and that is my main camera. I needed something small  and light to carry around when I did not want to lug around the heavier one, yet not so small that I would easily lose it. My main complaint is the lack of a user guide. Lets not be so cheap and if necessary just add the cost of the guide on to the purchase. It is ridiculous to have to print off a 180 page reference manual just to check out a few key items. I do not like reading manuals on the computer screen. Once I have used the camera and can compare it to the XTI I will add comments to my review.

Reviews.Title: This is an all around great camera
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: Let me say first, that I am a hobbiest. I do not photograph professionally. I do love photography, and I wanted a better camera than the one that I had, which was an HP Photosmart M540. I looked around to find the kind of camera that I wanted, and this one kept jumping off the page at me. I was originally going to buy a 200-250 dollar camera, but I decided to raise my price range, and go for this one. I have had it for over 4 months, and I am very satisfied with it. It has a capability to take great shots. My favorite setting is the Custom setting, where I can control the various camera settings. On the SCN setting, there is an ISO 3200 for capturing action shots. Is seems to be rather grainy, so I tend not to use it unless necessary. If you want a great camera, without going for the higher end models, then I highly reccommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Nancy Chang "nancy"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It's definitely no DLSR, but it's got plenty of features and takes great pictures.  I've only had time to play with the auto mode, but I'm already impressed.I also love the adjustable viewfinder, I've already used that many many times and find it so convenient!  Hopefully, this camera will last us a long time.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price, but...
Reviews.Author: M. R. Martin
Reviews.Content: ...to get the most out of your new camera, I strongly recommend Dennis Curtin's "A Short Course in Canon PowerShot SX20 IS Photography."  The camera is so much more flexible than I imagined, & Canon's User Guide only seems to skim the surface.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed
Reviews.Author: Patch Rowcester
Reviews.Content: Let me make this clear from the outset. I am not an enthusiast photographer. I don't know much about cameras, I am not an advanced user.I was looking for a good camera that could record high definition video, and this camera is perfect for me.Its not very portable, but it does the job very well. The zoom is fantastic.If you are looking for a very powerful camera that also works as a simple point and shoot camera, then this is fantastic.The only con is the lack of printed manual. i wish I had it, so that I could actually learn while I am outdoors.Great product for $369.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Sweigart
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this camera.  I love the way you can zoom in on subjects far away.  This is my fourth digital camera and I think I am content now with the one I have. The main reason I changed at this time is the last one I was using does not have a view finder and when you were taking pictures in the sunlight you could not tell just what you were getting in your shots.  This one has the viewfinder and with the tilt screen you can also see with that. I haven't used all the features yet but the ones I have used I would give a five star to all of them.Linda

Reviews.Title: still learning
Reviews.Author: J. Nixon
Reviews.Content: have only used it a few times so I am still learning all the features.  For taking basic pictures and videos however, it is just great!  It is a little heavy, but that is ok for me, just a little getting used to from my other Canon.  I love the flexibility of the lcd display and being able to open it and turn it.  The picture quality is great, the zoom is awesome, took some great landscape shots of flowers, they came out beautiful.  Don't like the viewfinder too much, maybe I don't have a grasp on it yet, but it seems like a telescope viewfinder and you are looking at your subject via mirrors.  But it isn't a huge issue since I use my lcd disply 99% of the time anyway.  Would have liked to have a printed user guide, it is inconvenient to have to go to the computer and open a pdf document everytime I want to look something up about a feature. Looking forward to learning more about the camera and it's features.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Marla E. Ingham
Reviews.Content: The camera was shipped and received in about 1 weeks time.  The camera was defective out of the box.  It showed "lens error".  A quick pohone call to Canon, and a total of 1 week (shipping and receiving return pkg)Canon warranted the camera faster than I could have returned it and received a replacement from Amazon.  The price for this camera was quite good!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: William D. Funk
Reviews.Content: The SX20IS does an excellent job for stationary subjects. The view finder is too small for following birds in flight. Optical zoom matches my spouse's S2IS performance. The digital zoom shots are all blurry, even with tripod. The camera is a huge step above the Sony Cybershot and Olympus models I have had.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: B. Graning "bgran03"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. It is several steps up from what i had. it is great and pretty easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: D. Watson
Reviews.Content: After owning a Canon Powershot S40 for many years, i felt it time to upgrade to a higher specification model. After many hours of research the choice was difficult but ultimately i decided on the SX20is. Not that you can believe all the reviews (after all, who really writes them??), but so many were positive about this model and the specifications were excellent. I have owned it for several weeks now, using it daily, and am happy to say that i have no complaints at all. It may not fit in your pocket but it is a quality camera which is very versatile indeed.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: sully "Cesar fan"
Reviews.Content: So far this camera has lived up to my expectations. I love the zoom and photos are crisp and clear. The camera is a bit bulky. Certainly isn't one I can throw into my purse or pocket, but it seems to be sturdy and well built. It is exactly what I was looking for to take photos on my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: It's a Canon
Reviews.Author: Bruce D. Moore "bruizer1"
Reviews.Content: I'm still evaluating this camera, but so far it has been great.  The zoom is the most interesting feature and I am finding out that even with the image stabilization a really close up zoom still requires the world to stand still.  Otherwise I am having fun with this camera, minimal zoom is great but the further you go the further stabilization you need.  The pics have been clear and crisp.  As for the price of the camera, this has been a good deal.  My first Digital camera was with Olympus and believe me, they don't care for their customers like Canon does.  I paid $500 plus for an extinct camera that Olympus did not support.  I had a 16mb card and even Olympus did not provide any upgrades or support for that camera.  However, the Canon SX20IS has been fun except for the extreme close-ups, of which the image stablization has been ineffective.  I have recently purchased a tri-pod which has helped with the extreme zoomed in close ups.  On average the zoom has been very successful.  This camera is highly recommended for the average user!

Reviews.Title: great for beginning amateurs!
Reviews.Author: sls68640
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to increase my photography skills. I've never taken classes but have been told I have an eye for photography. So I thought purchasing an advanced camera could help improve my skills. I have to say overall, I really like this camera. I love the variety of features. I do have to say it's a bit bulky/heavy, but it should be considering the features and the zoom quality. I do wish there was an easier way to learn about all the features besides downloading the 100+ page manual online. However, I'm sure with time I'll learn all the tricks and features of the camera!

Reviews.Title: best camera ever
Reviews.Author: D. Brown
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera nothing but good to say about it. This camera does everything you would want in photography!!  Can't take my hands off this camera goes everywhere does everything!! Photo and Video quality excellent....Danny

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed!
Reviews.Author: Roberto Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I've been looking for over the past few years. The perfect quality for what I need. Impressive performance at all times.

Reviews.Title: Pointing-& Shooting -- Top of the Line
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Scarcliff "Hawkeye"
Reviews.Content: The camera is still new to me so I haven't used all of its features yet or experimented with everything it offers.  Yet, it shows every sign of meeting my camera needs very well.  If I had a wish list for possible improvements it would be for better and more flexible auto bracketing and the ability to shoot in camera RAW.  But features like those are undoubtedly too much to ask for a camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Great Replacement for my S1
Reviews.Author: ReneP "ReneP"
Reviews.Content: I miss the button layout of the SX1, I looked at similar cameras from other manufacturers and the lens is a little slower than contemporary cameras I tried, but Canon's Image Stabilization I find is superior and outweighs some of the highlights of those other cameras.  The full manual feature and speed or apature controls are a necessity to me.It has done everything I want it to do and so much more.I am very satisfied with this Amazon purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: F. Jafri "Jaf"
Reviews.Content: I use the camera for personal occassions, parties, events, sightseeing, etc. Not a professional or expert photographer.Works great for my needs. Nice pics/vids. Many options for different situations. Great indoor shots with nice color quality and sharpness/focus which was my main problem with my Nikon CoolPix.Lens cap is a detached unit is the only drawback.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - High value
Reviews.Author: J. Lexo "Tool Nut"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Canon SX5 IS for my son 2 yrs ago and he has been very happy with it so I tried to buy one as well and found that the newer SX20IS had more features and cost less so it was a no-brainer. I have been very pleased with all the Canon products I've purchased even going back many years to their high-end film cameras and lenses. So far I cannot find a thing to complain about. It is a well thought-out product that is user friendly. I had a minor issue with the function of the flash & flash button, but I attribute that to the learning process. About the only complaint would be that I would have liked to purchase a UV lens with it to protect the main lens, but the size was not listed in the info on Amazon's or Canon's web site as best I could discern. I couldn't find a better value and I have come to trust the Canon product line.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX20is
Reviews.Author: Harti L. Sachser "Harti"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. I'd recommend this for those that want more that a simple point & shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, makes picture taking enjoyable again
Reviews.Author: Visa "James Buhl"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, makes picture taking enjoyable again; I have had a number of other digital cameras, which had some good aspects about each one. However, when taking pictures indoors or out doors there is no measurable difference in the resolution and picture quality with the SX20IS. I am so happy with it when I show my co-workers the quality; they can't believe it. Their comment, "it must be a really expensive camera;" when I tell them what I paid for it they're floored. Thanks Canon, for a great camera, you got this one right.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Saliya Ekanayake
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in December, 2009. It has been a great experience to take photos with this camera. I like the rich feature set available in this camera along with its long battery life. Moreover the HD Movie recording is absolutely wonderful for a camera of this nature.If you are really picky about the picture quality, however, you may find a noise, which is usually the case in all Mega Zoom cameras. Anyway, this won't affect much unless you view the images in 1:1 scale. Also if the light condition is good this effect is less visible.The bottom line is this is well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: Cannon SX20IS
Reviews.Author: John E. Sullivan "KathyMae"
Reviews.Content: I have only had the SX20IS for a few weeks, but I am very pleased with it so far. This is a great camera. I read a bunch of reviews before buying and so far it is living up to the other reviews. Great picture quality and I love the 20X zoom. If it works as well as my other Cannon cameras, I will be very satisfied. On top of that I paid less money on Amazon than the local price.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Maryanne Evans
Reviews.Content: I wanted a digital camera with a great zoom and the ability to do more with it than the traditional point and shoot.  This camera is it.  It's got great features, a super zoom lens and lots of things you can play around with, and if you don't want to do that, the auto is great.  The adjustable viewfinder is one of the features that sold this camera to me.  It's great for shooting under subjects or over subjects heads, etc.  If I needed to pick areas that could be improved it would be that the camera is a little bulky and that the instruction manual was online and I had to download and print.  Minor issues -- the pluses definitely outweigh.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Max Robo "Max Robo"
Reviews.Content: I first started taking digital photos when the Apple QuickTake 100 debuted. I've also owned Olympus (2 & 4 MP) & Nikon (8 MP) digital cameras. For the price, the SX 20 is a great camera that does all its jobs well.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS-Great camera.....
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L. Moore
Reviews.Content: Have been looking for a reasonable priced camera since mine broke, and wanted a Canon. Found this camera to be everything that I was hoping for.  Easy to use and takes great photos, has many features needed for quality photo taking.  Cost was reasonable, had another camera almost like this one that I used for years and was worried that I wouldn't find another camera that would take the quality of photos that I wanted.  Not wanting to break my budget, I found this camera in my price range and the quality that I wanted.  My family has nicknamed me 'Grandmarazzi' because I don't go anywhere without my camera.  Making memories is what photo taking is all about.  So, if you want a reasonable priced camera that takes quality photos, and easy to use, choose this one.  Go out and make memories with quality photos.  I was so happy to find this camera on Amazon.  It came quickly and everything was as they said it would be. I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX20 IS
Reviews.Author: Joanne F. Konst
Reviews.Content: Great camera with lots of features.  Not quite as sophisticated as a DSLR, but with many of the advantages of a DSLR over a point-and-shoot.Quite a learning curve, but since I had a previous model, my learning was applicable to this model and the transition was smooth.I recommend this camera to anyone who is not ready to buy a DSL but wants to have many of the advantages of such a system t half the price.

Reviews.Title: Amazinggggg
Reviews.Author: Cody Smith
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my fiancé and she absolutely loves it!! She's very into photography & I figures this would be the perfect birthday present!! I was right! :)

Reviews.Title: For the casual user
Reviews.Author: John Iacuzzo
Reviews.Content: I am a casual user of a camera...I wanted a camera that was not as complicated and costly as a SLR yet with greater capabilities than a compact..This camera fills the bill...The zoom mode is acceptable and the movie mode is ok for my needs...If the manual's directions are followed, the photos are clear and crisp...Initially, I thought that the the movie audio was poor, but I was only experiencing it in the playback mode thru the camera; my mistake, should view and hear thru the TV or the computer where the sound is perfect...All in all I enjoy picking it up.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for a point & shoot.
Reviews.Author: Tony Cruz "Tony"
Reviews.Content: This camera is probably one of the best point & shoot cameras I have ever tried. It takes great pics in daylight. However, I was a little disappointed when I tried it at a ceremony in a semi-dark large room. The pics were not that clear. On a positive note, if you learn to use the many features it has you can create some wonderful shots. Overall, I would recommend this camera to anyone who does not want to purchase a dslr.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: ssteacherlady "rob_dob"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good quality camera while sticking to a budget and the SX20IS was a great choice. I have been happy with the image quality and features it offers. Shoots as good as you want to shoot in manual. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Drop frames at 720p but a good camera overall
Reviews.Author: Jay W. Rhizor "Jay"
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera since December 2009. I own a Powershot 510 and enjoy using rechargeable AA batteries. I needed a bigger zoom to shoot birds down by the pond. I am happy with the zoom and the wide angle for interior shots. I use a tripod for the long shots but have had some success with full zoom hand-held shots.But since I use MS Movie Maker I was disappointed to find out that Microsoft doesn't support the .mov movie file type so I had to buy other video software. I also have notice in 720p the camera drops frames. I bought a high speed SD card, 30meg/sec, and it didn't help.I haven't contacted Canon yet, I hope there might be a firmware or something I can do since 720p was primary in my purchase requirements.Overall the wide angle and zoom while shooting movies is good. I have owned Canons since my first AE-1 back in 1980.Does anyone have any ideas on the drop frame?

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: A. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: I was either going to buy this camera or the Sony Cybershot DSC-HX1.  However, I have always had good luck with Canon cameras.  The cameras are very similar with a few trade-offs.  The decision came down to the external flash option with this camera.  I bought the Canon Speedlite 270 EX as well.  It makes an unbelievable difference with indoor photos.

Reviews.Title: Everything I had hoped for and more
Reviews.Author: Stephen Ingraham "lightshedder"
Reviews.Content: I have used the Sony H9, and then H50 for 4 years and love the flexibility of the super-zoom with articulated LCD and super-macro design. I was looking for a camera with the same features, but slightly higher image quality. The Canon is exactly that, with the bonus that it has a much more solid build than the Sonys. I have a more detailed review/first thoughts/impressions piece on my blog, Point & Shoot Landscape: [...]

Reviews.Title: Sure shot indeed!
Reviews.Author: Robert N. Copeland
Reviews.Content: For me this was the right choice of camera. It is easy to use in the auto mode or you can make your own adjustments if your more experienced. I am extemely pleased with the zooms sharpness and the stability feature. The more I use it the more I learn of its many many features.
