I would definately recommend this to anyone who wants quality pictures with a click of the button.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX20IS Best of Both Worlds
Reviews.Author: Emman Chehade "Mikeybaby"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, so many features, crisp video,  crisp pictures, this is a perfect hybrid camera.  The only problem is that the instruction manual is extremely short, it does not tell you how to navigate when you connect to the T.V.  Also it's heavy, but these shortcomings are not a big deal, this is an amazing camera well worth the price.  I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: D. Lambert "Lil' Momma"
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality and the videos are awesome!  It is hard to get pictures of my kids without something being a little blurred because they can't hold still.  There is probably a feature to help with this.  The zoom is also a great feature.  Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Good choice for entry-level
Reviews.Author: Victor Sanchez "Vicrol123"
Reviews.Content: Good zoom, the image stabilization works very well, good point to use batteries AA, LCD rotative, easy to use, 720 video, a lot of options! in a few words is a very good camera.-

Reviews.Title: OK Picture Qulity, Great Video, AF not so good,
Reviews.Author: C. Didato
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line if you want a camera that kicks butt at Long Range Video and can still take some good shots and allow for aperture control.  This Camera is it under $800.00Video is Great.Lens Range is Great.Auto focus is not so great (Compared to SD800)The Full Auto AF with options is hard to find.You'll need to read the manual to find the ISO 3000 setting (I haven't yet).For Low Light pictures with out a Tri-pod.  Forget it.  Get a point an shoot like the SD800 / SD 780.Honestly I think cannon could have done better,  But I needed to have both a great lense range (For Soccer Video) and High Quality Video and it need to be under $600.00.For the Money its pretty good.My theory is this, I can buy twice as good a camera every 18 months, for the same price as the last one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera-depending on your needs
Reviews.Author: Let's Ride the SS Cartagena "Romans 10:13 For...
Reviews.Content: As far as the body is concerned, the ergonomics of the camera are wonderful. I love to use the wheel instead of actual buttons, especially while using the manual mode. The camera fits very comfortably in your hand, as it should. I think that the camera has a good weight to it, its not too heavy to where its uncomfortable but its not so light that it doesn't really feel like a camera. Another note:YES THIS CAMERA IS THREADED SO YES YOU CAN ATTACH FILTERS TO IT. I had such a hard time trying to figure this out before I bought the camera because some sources said the camera couldn't take any filters and others said that it could. I found out myself that yes the camera does take 52 mm filters. I have had this camera for several months now and I thoroughly enjoy using it. The zoom lens work very well; they are quiet, fast, and they focus very nicely from wide angle to telephoto. I have only had one issue with the camera and that is with the close-up and macro photography modes. I do a lot of close-up/macro work so I was a little disappointed by the lack of magnetic power the lens have. The focusing is wonderful, you could literally touch the lens and still have your finger in focus, but it is not magnified to see the details. To me, macro/close up photography is about seeing the great detail in things that the human eye cannot perceive. While this camera keeps everything crisp and sharp it just didn't give me the versatility I desired with close-up photography. However, one set of lens cannot do it all so I don't really consider this too much of a fault. I just went ahead and bought macro filters and was happy again.  As far as night scenes are concerned, the longest shutter speed for this camera is 15 seconds. I have found that this is good enough to cover most generic nigh scenes. If you want a longer exposure or you do lots of night/low light photography then your better off getting another camera, probably an actual DSLR. The 3200 ISO on this camera isn't anything to be impressed with because the image quality is pretty bad. The ISO 1600 image quality is OKAY. I would say 800 and below are pretty good. Because this isn't a true DSLR camera don't expect DSlR image quality. The quality of the images are very atractive, but for the best quality possible you're going to have to put more money into a better camera.  From my several month's of experience with this camera I can honestly say I love it. It fulfills my needs very well, it's reliable, and its durable. The battery life is wonderful. If you are looking for a great camera at a great value then you can just stop right here. However, if you are looking for pristine, professional studio quality images then you will want to get an actual SLR.  I will be uploading photos that are unedited with no filters so that other's can see the image quality while the camera is at the full zoom and when it is not.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera but has a White Pixel
Reviews.Author: Wilfredo Nanita "Willy Nanita"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon and the service was fast. I received the camera and noticed a white dot or pixel on the resulting videos and pictures. I thought it was the lens, but no. It has something to do with the sensor. I asked for a new one.The new one came the next day I placed the return notice with the same White Pixel.Now I am asking for a third one and I am returning the other one (two cameras with the same problem). If the third one doesn't work either, I will have to ask for a refund and buy another brand with the same specifications if I can find it.I am giving this two stars for the great service shown by Amazon. They are not to blame for the problems this camera has.

Reviews.Title: Returned and got Panasonic FZ35
Reviews.Author: Jane Doe "It's ME"
Reviews.Content: Pros: high zoom, uses AA batteries, flip out screenCons: heavy, most pictures don't turn out well, does NOT support using filters or add-ons, no flash pop up buttonI tried the Canon SX20 and returned same day. Hated it! Took over 100 pictures at a party and 95% were grainy, over saturated, or to soft with ghosting and SX20 doesn't support adding filters. Must use a pop on 3rd party adapter.I ordered the Panasonic FZ35 and capture my kids doing kicks mid air and have 10+ macro lens, UV filter and protective lens. The SX20 wouldn't do that. I wanted something between a point and shoot and DSLR. FZ35 was the best.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Low price
Reviews.Author: Steven Tiger
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and play back of movies is in Hi Def with HDMI cable. Only two negatives, No printed manual and no wireless remote.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Amelia Sanford
Reviews.Content: We love our camera!  It takes great pictures and has tons of settings to use to make you pictures look professional

Reviews.Title: Outdoor shots are great. Indoor shots are terrible!!
Reviews.Author: LOUIS PAONE "drlgp"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for a couple of months now and have taken a lot of indoor and outdoor pictures with it. The outdoor pictures are awesome with a crisp sharpness to them and outstanding color. The zoom is fantastic.  But, the indoor shots are another story. For some reason no matter if the lighting is low or adequate half the pictures taken are out of focus and others have a yellow glow to them. No matter what I do I cannot take a great indoor shot. I thought it was just me but I had a friend , who is very good with photography, take indoor pictures with it and got the same results.It is also slow processing between pictures. So if you going to take action pictures, forget about it.I have always used a Kodak camera with good results so I figured I would get a highly rated camera to get outstanding pictures. I was half right. Outdoor shots blow away the Kodak but indoor shots Kodak wins by a long shot.Bottom line, I should have stuck with the old reliable Kodak.

Reviews.Title: The lens and the control panel were broken in less than 2 years
Reviews.Author: cb "cb"
Reviews.Content: I bought it in Dec 2009.Now the 20*lens and the control panel were broken.I can not adjust the lens. I can not use any function by the control panel.I can not even delete the pics after the memory card is full.Now I am looking for somebody who can fix it.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: that guy who wrote a review
Reviews.Content: hello everyone i am a young photographic enthusiast so i bought this camera to go a little farther it is a "advanced point n shoot" it has a really great auto for quick snaps anyone can take but manual is awesome too the only thing i dont like is the way you focus the zoom i love the omni directional screen i say get it... now... but whatever you do dont get the sx30 is it is the EXACT same hardware only they slap another number on it along with a bigger zoom but thats no good when pictures are blurryalthough i lost this cam when i moved

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Rodin"
Reviews.Content: After returning the defective Nikon P100 unit that I got earlier I bought the Canon SX20IS. This is a really nice camera that gives you plenty of manual and auto options. You can also use additional flashes and filters with it, 52mm, to enhance the quality of your picture taking.The size of this unit is probably the best I have seen for someone like me who likes to get a good grip while taking pictures. The ability to use regular AA alkaline, rechargeable, or Li-ion batteries means you never really run out of power while taking pictures. The fully articulating and swiveling screen is great for taking shots from unusual angles while still being able to see what you are recording. The 12MP CCD sensor coupled with a 20x zoom is just right for this camera.This camera was going to be a keeper for me, but thanks to my wife who just bought me the latest version of this style the Canon SX30IS, which has a 14MP CMOS sensor with an incredible 35x zoom I feel like a kid in a candy store.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX20is
Reviews.Author: Marvin Perry "Retired Programmer"
Reviews.Content: We have had a SONY DSC-T100 (Super Steady Shot) for several years now and it has always given us very good photographs, but lately they have been BLURRED when there wasn't even any action (portrait) going on - -  like a "ghost" image: even with electronic flash.So I poured over the reviews for Canon, Panasonic, and Nikon, and decided that the Canon had the least amount of negative reviews.  After receiving the camera and having taken less than 100 pictures with it, I can say that the COLOR is MUCH BETTER than previous cameras that I have owned, HOWEVER, some of the photographs are NOT SHARP, as if it didn't get a chance to focus the camera.  Unlike the SONY, I cannot turn the image stabilizer on or off - - it's just there working in the background (I hope).The one disappointment that I have is that I cannot turn the flash ON to flash all the time (fill-in flash).  There may be a way of doing that, but I haven't learned it yet.For those who complained about the shadow created when the flash is used with the sun-shade on the lens, let me  offer this suggestion:  REVERSE the sun-shade on the lens, and ONLY turn it around to be used as a SUN SHADE when taking pictures in full sunlight.  That way it also fits into the camera case easierOver-all, I am glad that I bought the camera and it works perfectly with my iMac:  in fact I have LESS correction to do using iPhoto, than when using my Sony.UPDATE:  After 4-months of use, I can now give this camera 5-stars.  Photographs taken under natural light, inside or outside, are gorgeous.  I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Best among other brands
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This camera was the winner for a class of Digital photography, but you have to be dealing to much with the camera to get a good picture so no everyone can take a great picture with this one. Anyways all the features are great, I hope the add some from Nikon and from Kodak in the next release.

Reviews.Title: SENDING IT BACK
Reviews.Author: H. Bowman "Mailman"
Reviews.Content: Went to a church wedding on Sat and here are the results....Flash takes to long to power up....Bad low light focus...I now know its  heavy....Most of all the zoom switch is VERY load during recording...I mean very bad...Clicking......I orig bought the fz35 which I was going to give  son.....But I'll keep for me and send back sx20....Will check out fz40 first...Do yourself a favor and checkout zoom switch...

Reviews.Title: Extremely happy
Reviews.Author: Ashley Cochran "Ashley"
Reviews.Content: I had previously owned the SX10IS and when I saw they came out with a newer version I had to have it. I'm not a professional or even an amateur photographer; I simply take a lot of pictures of my family and I wanted a camera that was easy to use and would do the work for me so that my pictures turned out great. That is how I ended up with the SX 10IS as it did exactly this. The biggest improvement in this camera in my opinion is that it now automatically adjusts from face recognition to object recognition. So when I'm trying to get a picture of my baby's toes I don't have to manually adjust it, it does it for me now! I'm so pleased that I decided to make the investment to upgrade, it really is a great camera!

Reviews.Title: perfect piece
Reviews.Author: Ahtesham
Reviews.Content: Continous shots: I took continous shots with ease.display:I was standing in crowd and tried to take a picture.I just had to raise Camera and turn the display and took my shot.I have very good rechargable AA batteries. and That way I am even happier.Also some of the features amazed me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Dav-Mi
Reviews.Content: We wanted to upgrade to a practical, high quality point and shoot camera that we could take "professional looking" photos with. We had originally decided on a Sony of comparable price but changed our minds and purchased this instead. The main reasons we went with this one are the ability to use regular AA batteries in a pinch, and the fact that it takes a SD memory card, which is compatible with our other devices. We're using rechargeable Ni-MH AA's in it and so far, so good. As far as use time- I charged them up for the first time 2 days ago and they are still going strong. I'm just amazed at the quality of the photos this camera takes, and frankly, I don't even know how to really use the features of it... yet. I definitely recommend purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: Auto and shooting modes are not as good as S5is
Reviews.Author: Mahmood
Reviews.Content: I recently upgraded to this model from S5 IS.  I am using it for a couple of months now but still confuse give it 5 stars.As  compare to S5, overall hardware is outstanding. I am satisfied with most the still and HD video features.  I am however unsatisfied  with  picture quality in auto  and shooting  modes. The quality of picture is less then S5. In indoor picture is dark even with external flash. Outdoor pictures are OK as far as there is no sharp difference between shade and sunlight. On a sunny day it is too difficult to take scenic picture with some what blue sky and shady hills. Either hills goes too dark or sky goes too white, depends which one you focus first.  FYI! I tried both with Auto Contrast on and off modes. I think probably the worst design flaw is that you cannot use external filters, there is no thread for  filters or filter adapter.  It is however blessing that "Janco " has come up with an alternative adapter, some what workaround.The camera takes outstanding stunning picture in Program mode.  After understand of  camera settings and their effects on light and shade, I was able to capture blue sky and vivid green hills on a sunny day.For outdoor shooting I am also using  "Graduated Neutral Density lens" a very useful tool. It does make the life easier to work with this camera.Bottom line - if you are looking for high-end low-budget camera where you know how  to manipulate camera settings and  then this camera is for you. If you are looking for just a point and shot camera  then you should consider other models.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money for a near SLR
Reviews.Author: A. Ramon
Reviews.Content: This Camera is a lot like a D-SLR camera, save for not having an interchangeable lens as well as other features I am currently not aware of. The 20x zoom is really effective, and battery life is great. The pictures always come out really well. Overall, this is a really good camera provided you are aware that it is NOT an SLR. If a D-SLR is what you want or are looking for, than look for said type of camera. While this camera is one of the best point and shoot digital cameras, I know that it does not rival a SLR.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Cassie Fiedler "cass8302"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera and have been toying around with it in the house and so far the picture quality has been great!  The auto is a little to vivid for my liking, so I just change to custom and turn the color to natural.  The zoom is great and easy to focus when you zoom fast.  The real test will be when I attend concerts, how well the low lighting shots will turn out!  Can't wait to test it out some more

Reviews.Title: Fine and simple camera to use.
Reviews.Author: Donald Erker "Don"
Reviews.Content: As a film camera buff for many years I finally went digital.  I really like this camera and especially its auto-focus feature.  I have difficulty seeing and this takes the guess work out of focusing.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: Sanjay Sharma "gemisanjay"
Reviews.Content: I love my Canon SX20IS, my first megazoom camera. It takes awesome pics and ease of use is good. Auto mode is good for most cases. Mega Zoom works good. Photography for me is m babies photo. And i love when i get cute pictures from this camera. still learning about features it has and Video quality is again very good and you can zoom in and out during recording. In-House shots are also awesome.

Reviews.Title: DEFINITELY WORTH IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Croes
Reviews.Content: After looking at a bunch of cameras, reviews, prices and features, and finally decided to go with the Canon SX20IS. It finally arrived today, and I couldn't wait to take pictures. It was very easy to get it started, I didn't have to look at any manual to start taking pictures. I read some reviews of people saying that the camera doesn't take good pictures in auto mode, well, I didn't have any problem taking awesome pictures in auto mode. All my pictures came out clear and very nice.I tested out the video recording, and was very impressed with the quality of the video (of course HD), and the voice. It really picks up on everything around you.Many reviewers also stated that they had problems with the lens cap falling off, I can't say too much about that yet, since I just got the camera today, but from what I can see, it holds firmly to the lens, and you can actually hear the click when it is attached.All in all I'm extremely happy with my choice, and can't wait to see what else this camera has in store for me.I'll keep you updated.I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone, for the price, you can't get a better deal ;)

Reviews.Title: Canon SX20
Reviews.Author: Chief Bob
Reviews.Content: The only real negative thing about this camera is the lack of threads on the front of the lens so filters can be used.  The only way to use filters is to purchase a sort of "mickey mouse" adapter to mount on the camera and then the filters will screw on like on a normal camera.  It is hard to believe that Canon thought of so many things but did not add threads so normal filters could be used.  A rather major oversight.  There are reports that filters can be screwed on but there are definitely no threads so if a filter does "stick" it is just luck and should not be trusted.An additional issue is that this camera does not come with a printed instruction like all Canon cameras used to come with.  The instruction manual is on a CD so to refer to it, one has to "carry" a computer along.  Canon states this as "going green"  which obviously means they have more green dollars in their pocket with the money they save on printing and shipping printed manuals.  The camera is rather complicated so a manual is an absolute necessity to be able to use all the features available.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, great value
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Shastany
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera.  I was up and running immediately taking great pictures.  This is the ideal choice for someone who wants the ease of a point and shoot camera with the features of an SLR.  The Optical Zoom delivers outstanding shots and clarity.  The only drawback I have seen with the camera has already been posted by others.  I thought that the reviewers were nitpicking about issues with the lens cap falling off, but it is frustrating that the cheapest part of the camera can put your lens at risk. Canon really should make good on this piece, then we will have nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Thomas P. Mcgugan "Wndsrfr48"
Reviews.Content: While not as sophisticated ( or costly) as a DSLR, this point & shoot offers good quality photos quickly with minimum hassle.  The 20X zoom is great for sports and nature shots.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love This Camera!
Reviews.Author: H. Borja
Reviews.Content: I just traded in my Kodak V550 to get serious about learning how to take great photos, and I am so glad I did. I did a lot of research to try and find a camera that I could learn from and still took great photos, and the SX20 IS was the winner, even though I really wanted a DSLR. I made a great choice! I'm still getting the hang of the camera, but have turned out so many great photos that I could NEVER get with my Kodak. The HD video is a great feature to have with my growing toddler and my desire to capture her precious moments. The weight is fine for me and doesn't affect my rating for it's portability. I'll be travelling soon, and I am so glad that I chose this over the DSLR because of well portability! Can't wait to learn how to use this camera at its FULL potential!

Reviews.Title: Maybe the one I received was faulty; but horrible photo quality.
Reviews.Author: kakbob "kakbob"
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, but felt compelled to do so after the bad experience I received with this camera. Maybe the camera I did receive was faulty. I was really excited and wanted this camera to work. I tried pictures in all settings/modes and I received the same photo quality. All pictures were not sharp, color was not there and that was for outside pictures. Inside pictures were even worse. The flash on this camera is really weak in my opinion and can barely add light to a subject. My inside pictures were almost laughable the quality was so bad. I have a 5+ year old little pocket point and shoot camera that I used in the same spots with/without the flash and the pictures came out way better than they did with this camera.I will say that the zoom is really good and was impressed on how far it could zoom out. Anyway, I had to return this camera. I was very disappointed with the photo quality as I was expecting much better quality than my old point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Beck Farmer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last year and have given sufficient time for forming an opinion.  During the last three weeks, the camera was used for three baby showers.  All rooms had high ceilings, so lighting was a MAJOR problem.  I am very disappointed, and unfortunately, those occasions cannot be recaptured.  Every shot was hazy!  I am a novice, and it shows.  Because the manual is not a hard copy, there is no time to look up a solution unless you have access to a computer and time to search. For my purposes...a camera that I could point and shoot and get quality images, this was a bad choice. My Canon PowerShot SD780 IS is much better...just wanted a better zoom.

Reviews.Title: Must Have!
Reviews.Content: This camera is GREAT!!!  The quality of picture is unbelieveable.  And it's so cheap.I would recommend for everyone to purchase one.

Reviews.Title: After six months of use, I can't recommend this camera
Reviews.Author: Scoot395
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on April 22, 2010.  It is now October 14, 2010 and this camera is developing problems already...When I first got this camera, I was blown away by the quality of the pictures.  But after using it for six months I have begun to notice things about its performance that aren't so attractive, and a very serious problem with this camera has developed.First, the problem...  I am unsure when it started, but about a month after getting this camera I noticed a white pixel when taking pics zoomed at 80X.  I didn't think it was a big deal at the time because I rarely zoom that far.  But last night and tonight I have been taking pics of the moon, and I noticed that the pixel is now visible even when not zooming at all.  It is showing up in ALL of my pics, no matter how it is zoomed.  I bought this camera based on the quality of an old Canon Rebel G SLR I've been having for 12 -years-.  Now, after six -months-, this digital camera is beginning to crap out on me.  That is a bit ridiculous.Also, this camera takes horrible night pictures.  I am mainly using it for experimenting with astrophotography and I am beginning to see that regardless of Canon's claims, this is NOT the camera for low-light photos.  Even in some normally lit photos, dark objects will be very grainy with black and dark gray artifacts throughout the dark objects.  Night photos are almost impossible to get without grain.  When I take moon photos, I have to heavily manipulate the brightness and contrast afterward to get rid of the overwhelming noise and grain in the photo.The autofocus is another issue that might trouble some people.  Some light conditions are impossible for the autofocus (such as a full moon when zoomed in 80X).  This would not be a problem for me since sky shots require you to focus on infinity, but focusing on infinity doesn't quite focus the shot either.  Manual focus works fairly well, but it is still hard to tell if your shot is actually focused when looking at a small LCD screen.  Many times, I have taken a shot I thought was focused only to find out once I loaded it onto my laptop that it wasn't focused at all.There are a lot of small things like this that plague this camera, but I feel like I am beginning to rant.  I will just stop here and say that this is a nice camera at first, but apparently Canon has forgotten how to build quality.  The burned out pixel(s) are the deal breaker for me.  I don't know if I should trust Canon anymore.

Reviews.Title: Canon is the best
Reviews.Author: kwanemma
Reviews.Content: This is my first Canon Camera,i always got a Sony or Nikon.but this is a very good quality camera.Mr Kwan

Reviews.Title: AverageCamera
Reviews.Author: Maninder Singh "Maninder"
Reviews.Content: Hi,This is my third canon and the most disappointing one. Most of the pictures are blury and soft even at medium light conditions. The autfocus takes hell lot of time while focusing on high zooms. I have taken approx. 400 pictures and all the ones taken with Auto focus are overexposed which is a huge setback.The 20x zoom can be as good as a feature as images that come out, no use of such a high zoom when images are not sharp enough. My A710 works better than this camera.The buid quality is great, the articulating screen and perfect.manual mode works fine, in fact I have stopped using auto mode. Great camera if you know manual mode settings, not for those looking for point and shoot camera with high zoom.Battery life is very good, I am still using the ones shipped with camera (though 90% of images were taken in daylight).Overall a big disappointment from Canon.Cons:Soft & Overexposed picturesgrains for indoor shotspoor auto modecamera fails to focus most of the time resulting in blur and softness.Pros:build qualitybattery lifemanual mode

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sx20Is
Reviews.Author: Joseph Reznick "Wantabe photographer"
Reviews.Content: Camera is awsome a friend is pro photogragher and she has never seen anything like it for the money.I asked her to guess how much I paid for it and she said $850!!!!!I think I got a real deal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not Bad AT ALL!!!
Reviews.Author: Richard Calamari "tirips"
Reviews.Content: When this amature received this camera I was overwhelmed with all the buttons.  I would have really liked recieving a copy of the manual to bring along with me on trips.  I know it is big, but to print 182 is not my cup of tea.  The instructions though are clear - so I have learned to go step by step.The buttons on the camera are very close to each other and this takes practice.I would have liked the lens cover to b somewho attached better than what is suggested.Qtherwise it is a fantastic camera and takes some very interesting pictures.  The Zoom is fantastic.  Living in Alaska I have been able to take some GREAT pictures of animals.

Reviews.Title: Christmas present for our budding photographer
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Our 15 year old daughter's only request for a Christmas gift was this camera.  She is interested in learning more about photography and being creative with her shots.  She LOVES this!  It is a high quality camera and the pictures are so crystal clear!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Garden Addict
Reviews.Content: I'm now a shutter-bug because if this wonderful piece of equipment. The articulating lense, photo clarity and ease of use really make this camera number 1 in my book!

Reviews.Title: Wife loved it!
Reviews.Author: Tracy A. Poole "oldmetalphart"
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife last Christmas and she has used it constantly...and loves it.  Good camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a non-photographer
Reviews.Author: Z. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photographer by any means; however, I did want a nice camera that was within my price range. I've had this for a few years now and am very happy with it. It can take a wide variety of shots without needing special lenses.

Reviews.Title: Camera not starting
Reviews.Author: KJEW
Reviews.Content: I loaded the camera with brand new AA batteries, however it blinked once then tells me that the battery is low and went blank.  I tried another set of batteries which gave the same result. I also change a small (one that looks like those for watches) battery that I found need the power button, still it will not come on.It use to work perfectly before.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Stiefel
Reviews.Content: Arrived quickly and I was able to use it with little review of the manuel.  Great pictures and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: J. Halleron "Judy"
Reviews.Content: Have used the camera a few times in daylight.  No problems.  Will know more when I have more time to experiment.  Getting ready for a trip so have been busy.  Will use the camera more while on trip.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "TheOilStory"
Reviews.Content: Wow, for the price of this camera, you would think they could have included the 180 page instruction manual. I had the Canon Powershot A94 I purchased from Amazon in 2004... EXCELLENT camera. I wish Canon would bring that one back. It was easy to hold, easy to shoot and took excellent photos with tons of features. This camera is excellent in the photo department and the features are all there... but, it is heavy, bulky and I do NOT like the lens cap at all... it needs to have a strap attached from cap to the camera. Anyway, very disappointed the instruction manual is not included and I am disappointed that the only options out there are either the really small palm size digitals or this bulky size... BRING BACK THE A95 Series!

Reviews.Title: Powershot SX 20 IS
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my camera. It is easy to use and very portable. The only thing is that I wish the manual told you more about the settings but the manual that you can download on to your computer tells you more.

Reviews.Title: Easty to use great anytime anywhere
Reviews.Author: Johnny Hernandez "jjoeh3"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use anywhere for any occasion and it is my choice of Price it can preform great and comes with great software the only down fall with it is that it uses 4 AA battery and your going to have to keep buying some or use AA battery rechargeable ones

Reviews.Title: Cannon SR20
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Great camera with a lot of features and a great zoom.  It goes up to 80x digitally and you can enlarge from there on the display.  I drilled two 1/16" holes in the cap an 1/8" apart to put a small string in to attach to the camera.  I could imagine losing the cap in a week otherwise.  I don't see a reason to get an SLR with all the things this camera will do.It is a good thing I got an optional 8gig card for the camera since it didn't come with one.

Reviews.Title: Review after Review
Reviews.Author: Carl A. Houston
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX20IS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 20x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch Articulating LCD I read and read, researched and researched...in the end I was suffering from info overload. I had selected the Canon Powershot SX20IS, a Sony and a Panasonic as the finalists. I chose Canon because I have used Canon cameras off and on for thirty years. The reasons I chose the SX20IS were;1. It was a canon2. My current camera was a canon I570..love it3. Stereo sound recording for Hi Def videos (720p)4. Longer zoom.5. Color swap (download the PDF manual for more info)6. Familiarity with the canon menus and buttons.7. Amazon Customer Service *****8. Amazon pricing!!!Cons;1. Heavy and bulky (2 1/2 pounds ) not unlike a DSLR , but much lighter price wise :)2. A small percentage of pics look over saturated with color ( an easy fix if you have Photoshop )3. Amazon free shipping (almost 2 weeks)

Reviews.Title: More than I could ask for
Reviews.Author: J. Coughlin
Reviews.Content: This camera is seriously the most dank (in a great way) piece of equipment I own. I have had little point and shoot cameras in the past which surprisingly took decent quality photos, but this camera is great for any explorer. The zoom is incredible and so sharp once you have the subject focused. I have not yet taken this puppy out in the real world yet, so I am super excited to really give it a try. This camera is definitly for any photo-taking lover, and seems like it is a level lower than an SLR. BUY IT!

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Christer Gustavii
Reviews.Content: I have not been using this camera for so long time yet, but it seam to be a nice camera. I am particularly impressed by the filming capabilities (HD). Very nice picture and the sound is great. The zoom is also impressive.

Reviews.Title: A TOP NOTCH CAMERA
Reviews.Author: James E. Templin
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA WAS PURCHASED ON A RECCOMENDATION FROM MANY WEBSITES.  I WANTED IT FOR THE GREAT OPTICAL ZOOM.  IT TURNED OUT THAT IT WAS LARGER AND HEAVIER THAN I HAD EXPECTED.  IT IS MORE COMPLICATED THAN I EXPECTED BUT I AM GETTING FAMILIAR WITH THE OPTIONS AND FEATURES.  WOW, A 180 PAGE MANUAL TO USE !!  THE MORE I USE IT, THE MORE I LIKE IT.  I JUST HAVE TO GET OVER THE "OLD GUY" MENTALITY.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great!
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is gret , I recommend it to any ameture photoghrapher like myself. The zoom is great and I love the super macro for getting up close with plants. I"ve only had this for a month and I have already taken some really great pictures with it!  My FAVORITE thing about this cameras video option is the slow motion playback it could keep me enertaind for hours. But, anyways this camera takes sharp ,clear pictures I love the fact that it can locate someones face when you are taking a portrait its so much easier know. the flash on this camera's pretty good to its not too bright. For those of you who think that the night option stinks, it doesn't ,it takes lots of time and practice (im getting better with it). Like i said i recommend this camera to anybody!!

Reviews.Title: so so pictures.
Reviews.Author: scuba granny
Reviews.Content: I haven't used this camera much since getting it. But so far, I feel the picture quality in auto mode (I'm not real camera saavy) isn't as good as I thought it would be. I haven't really had the chance to get familiar with manual settings. I do love the articulating lcd screen; it allows you to get any angle desired.

Reviews.Title: muy buena camara
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos Baãados "JCBanados"
Reviews.Content: Es una camara excelente, siendo un afinionado a la fotografía, he probado todos sus modos de operación y la encuentro fácil de usar, con una excelentes fotos y unos videos muy buenos.Solamente me ha costado regular en el modo manual completo (velocidad, apertura e ISO) y las pilas o bateria duran poco pero esto último es por el uso que le he dado (revisar las fotos y videos desde la camara)El software que trae es muy útil a la hora de bajar videos pesados (sobre 2,5 Gb).He sacado fotos de noche y son muy buenas, el zoom ayuda mucho al sacar fotos de flores y de personas.Su visor rotatorio ayuda mucho a tomas desde diferentes posiciones, muy práctico.En resumen es una excelente camara.

Reviews.Title: Focus Problems & Slow Shutter Speed
Reviews.Author: M. Deal
Reviews.Content: I am a 'point n shoot' photographer and could care less about all the technical discussion around a camera.  I just want a dependable camera that will take decent indoor/outdoor photos and movies at a reasonable price without a lot of hassel. This camera does NOT fill the bill.Pros:*  Easy to hold.*  Nice optical zoom feature that can also be used for movies without degrading the quality when the zoom is extended.*  Able to take a photo while shooting a movie.*  Reasonable battery life (highly recommend rechargeable batteries).*  Ok menu features.Cons:*  Has great difficulties focusing when not outside... frequent out of focus indoor pictures.*  Periodic focus problems when taking movies outside... inside movie focus is only marginally acceptable.*  Slow shutter speed ... you can go to lunch while the camera decides to let you take a picture. (Yes, the batteries are fully charged!)*  Recycle time of flash is VERY slow (Yes, the batteries are fully charged!)*  This is a terrible camera for photos at sports events ... movies work fine outside with exception of periodic focus issues.Recommendation:If you are a casual user and/or won't use all the features of this type of camera, save your money and buy a different and less expensive camera.  There are a LOT of good point and shoot cameras on the market for less than $200.

Reviews.Title: canon,yeah!
Reviews.Author: squeegee
Reviews.Content: i got my camera pretty quick. it is everything they said it would be. i really love having it with me. i missed my camera because my previois one was stolen. thanks amazon.

Reviews.Title: bad choice
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Richards
Reviews.Content: this was my first Canon hoping to get a good quality camera,but got a camera far below my usual Nikons.The camera has buttons right were you put your thumb that with a little touch changes the setting.I really bought this camera for the zoom so when I get a nice nature shot it is full of noise and making a once in a life time miss.The Batt life in this camera is so poor it makes me want to throw it in the pond.Taking pictures indoors is also poor quality,so I guess all in all this camera might be going by-by.It is ashame for I really checked all of the reviews and I read that some had the same problems but some were happy and it seemed like other camera,s had the same problems in the zoom mode for which I bought the camera for.I will stick with my slr Nikon,s.If anyone has some suggestion please send a review for bigT.I wanted a camera this size to take on my hikesin the woods so I hate to give it up fir it,s size.

Reviews.Title: A disappointment
Reviews.Author: Ken Lyon
Reviews.Content: I bought my SX20IS as an upgrade to my S3IS, with which I'd been pretty happy. I take a lot of available light indoor pictures, many during church services. I had gotten some good pix with the S3, but wanted the allegedly better low-light capability of the SX20IS, plus the 20x zoom. What I got was a bigger, heavier camera that is only marginally better than the S3 in low light conditions while taking a lot longer per exposure--and whose overall picture quality isn't as good as what I've gotten with my old S3.I'm sure it's a good camera, but not what I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: canon sx20is
Reviews.Author: DJM
Reviews.Content: Briefly, if you ever used a DSLR you more or less see the picture your taking and can expect good results, but with the Canon (SX20 IS) what you see through the viewfinder is not always what you get, You just have to trust that the picture will look good and typically they do.The LCD Monitor is a real plus for low and high angle shots.The video is really good quality.Myself, I think it's more complicated than a DSLR.Plan on spending a lot of time reading the manual, if you want quick pictures, buy a point and shoot.This is not a DSLR.Dave

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera - with a few quirks
Reviews.Author: kjs4usc
Reviews.Content: Great Camera!  But here's a word to the wise - DON'T FORMAT THE CARD after you've taken pictures!  It deleted all of my pictures that I took for my 30th birthday party...I was SO upset.  I did download a software that retrieved them, but still - the camera gave absolutely no warning before it deleted 130 pictures.  I was in shock.  It is also a heavy camera, be prepared for your arm to get sore while trying to shoot moving subjects.Other than that - I've taken some incredible photos and I've had the camera less than a week.  It's easy to use, and captures wildlife effortlessly.  I've taken some gorgeous photos of hummingbirds, and they aren't easy to photograph.You will love this camera!  It's definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: BEST POINT AND SHOOT !!!
Reviews.Author: R. Willis
Reviews.Content: I AM COMPLETELY BLOWN AWAY BY THE FEATURES ON THIS CAMERA!!! IT, IN MY OPINION RIVALS SOME OF THE BEST DSLR'S ON THE MARKET FOR MOST PEOPLE. I AM NOT A PROFESSIONAL, BUT HAVE SPENT MUCH OF MY LIFE TAKING PICTURES- AND LOVE THIS CAMERA!!

Reviews.Title: nice camera for the money
Reviews.Author: gabbasix
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a suggestion from someone who uses it for good, clear ebay photos.  Its macro setting is excellent for the money.

Reviews.Title: Accessories have annoying shortcomings
Reviews.Author: Gregor Wollmann
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is quite nice for users that want more control but are not ready for SLR.  However, the manual is terrible.  For starters the complete manual is available only on CD, no hard copy. The manual is very poorly organized. I ended up writing my own summary instructions and keep them with the camera case.  With so many functions, it is impossible to remember everything it does.The lense cap is lose and easily lost.  I just lost mine and came back to this site to find a replacement.  Replacements seem to cost $12 and up.

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: Chao Yang
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. It is perfect for the people who want to get high quality pics but do not spend a lot of money on SLRs.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Theodore Renkor "Hezokuai"
Reviews.Content: Better than I expected. As I had read before however, the includded booklet is useless. You have to use the e-manual to get any idea how to more than just point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: waterloo "Napoleon"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace another make that broke. First real use was at the Daytona 500.  Great pictures.

Reviews.Title: An interesting mix of ups and downs
Reviews.Author: Billy The Kid
Reviews.Content: For a camera comprising nearly all desirable features in one package, this one filled the bill for me - stills, videos, external flash hot shoe, long lens, swivel display, little shutter delay, fast start up, anti-shake, AA batteries and more portable than a DSLR.  Still pix so far are sharp and well exposed. I have not shot videos yet. My peeves: the lens cap comes off too easily and is not attached to the camera. That's a lost item waiting to happen. I know DSLRs don't attach them but they are not so easily dislodged. Going from viewing pix back to taking pix has to pass through a shut down step. Why? My DSLR doesn't force that choice. Maybe I need more training. These super zooms compromise pix quality with  extra long lenses and high pixel counts. I'd rather have less lens and a larger sensor to improve quality but this S20 is better than its predecessors. Flash power: This one really needs an external flash to gain meaningful distance so thanks for the hot shoe.  With the lens shade installed, any flash picture shot at the widest angle and with the pop-up flash gets that shade shadow "nose" in the bottom of the picture. It's a nuisance to remove the shade for indoors and replace it for outdoors. Just make a shade where the flash shadow doesn't happen or raise the flash a bit more.  I know - use an external flash or avoid that setting.  Those are undesirable, but apparently necessary compromises. Again, no such problems with my DSLR. Also the lens shade twists off way too easily. Some of buttons on the back are a bit close together for my fat thumb so I sometimes make commands I didn't want to make.  More training. These are little issues for which there are some fixes and some learning that provide solutions. Overall the camera provides a one-box mix of all the most important camera features, especially when considering packing small for travel. It was a good choice for that reason alone. It's not as small as some but not bad for what it does. Ruggedness, longevity and reliability tests are to come.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: Pre School Teacher "preschool teacher"
Reviews.Content: very happy with the service!  Great quality and excited to put the camera to work for me!

Reviews.Title: Beware Lens failures after warranty period
Reviews.Author: jb
Reviews.Content: When it was working, it took great pictures and was very easy to use.I purchased this camera just over and year ago and now it won't work. Of course it has a 1 year warranty. My sister purchased her's about the same time and it is not working. Checking online and we are not alone in having problems with this camera, or other canon cameras.Between me and my sister we are two for two on failures with this model after about a year.

Reviews.Title: Low quality results
Reviews.Author: Maguiabel
Reviews.Content: This camera is in the middle of a pocket and a SLR.If you are a begginner, and you are not to use the manual functions of the camera, i recommend you to purchase a pocket camera, maybe with better resolution, which will be cheaper and u will have better results.But if you want to practice to be a professional photographer, you must spend another 200 dollars and buy a professional SLR camera.This camera is good for practicing lighting and manual mode, but the results of the photograph are poor.The image is note good enough to have post production in photoshop.I also have a complaint in night photos, they are no good, sometimes pixelated.Hope this to be useful.I bought this camera last year when i was begging to studying photography and i already sold it to buy an SLR.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: CJB
Reviews.Content: After doing a little research, and talking with people I know who use this camera's predecessor, I thoughtI had finally found what I was looking for, an easy to use camera that takes awesome inside and action shots. Wrong. The image stabilization is a joke. I am not at all impressed.

Reviews.Title: Nice Package.........Bad/Noisy Pics
Reviews.Author: R. Fraley "JustRalph"
Reviews.Content: Bought it, Loved the package. Everything was great except the picture quality.  The Video quality was excellent. The Still Pictures were middle of the road at best.  In all settings, under all circumstances the pic's were just middle of the road and in many cases very noisy,blurry etc.  Tried sharpening them up with software, and the raw material you are working with just isn't up to par.  Sorry.........returned it. Will try something else.  Btw, I love Canon Camera's and have two others.  This one just didn't cut it.

Reviews.Title: 15% good shots
Reviews.Author: A. Psychiatrist
Reviews.Content: I gave my slr to my daughter last fall, but decided I wanted a smaller do-all camera, and this seemed like it.Maybe I'm spoiled, but only 1 out of 6 or 7 pictures weren't blurry after a family get together [about 30 pics or so].  The SLR I had was much more reliable, and I'm now buying another SLR.  I like Canon, and my wife gets great shots with her Elph.Update 1/10/10 thanks for the comment. I'm getting better pictures; maybe the situation comes into play.  Better focus in quieter settings, able to take time. Have uploaded indoor and outdoor pics.

Reviews.Title: What's all the hype about?
Reviews.Author: Ken Hall
Reviews.Content: Well, I am for one not that impressed.  I thought by upgrading to this camera from my 4MP Olympus (sadly it quit working) that I would at least have comparable pictures with Image Stabilizing and more Mega-pixels.  But being totally honest, this camera has disappointed me with each shooting experience.  I have checked all settings, even changing the resolution but wasn't satisfied with the results.  I'm no professional, but I would think that this camera should at least have matched my other camera in picture quality.  Sadly it hasn't and the $400 that I spent is now gone.  Wish my Olympus still worked because the pictures from it were quite frankly better than this.  There are a bunch of features, but I would trade them all in for a camera that took better pictures.  The image stabilization doesn't even work well at all.  Trying to hold the camera against a solid object still has the pictures come out with blur.  All my pictures are grainy.  All in all, I wish I hadn't bought this camera and am looking forward to selling it, even if I don't get what I paid.  That's how disappointed I am.  I am now searching for a replacement (haven't even had this camera for two weeks yet!) that takes great pictures.  Anyone want a camera?  Sheesh.....

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 20x Wide Angle Optical
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I understand I was buying a used camera, but description also said works, what it should have said will power on and then power back off when you try to push button to take picture.

Reviews.Title: recommendable
Reviews.Author: consuelo zermeno
Reviews.Content: The chamber that needed, since I am not very expert of photograph and is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: Use friendly, not environment friendly
Reviews.Author: Luiz Mello
Reviews.Content: The camera is fantastic. The 20x zoom allows me to fill the frame with a singer's face while seating across the stadium in a concert, or to zoom in on a coach's face (or a hot cheerleader, for that matter) while seating on the other side of a soccer field. There are several cool functions, like the sports setting that takes continuous photos - works best with faster grade SD cards. The battery life is not great - maybe 300 photos, half of which with flash. You're better off not even turning off the camera and just setting the display to turn off after 20 seconds.The only inconvenience of this camera is the use of 4 AA batteries. I haven't yet purchased a set of rechargeable to see how long they last. Nonetheless, Canon's idea that "you can pick up batteries in any store" is very unfriendly of the environment, and a built-in rechargeable battery is the way to go (it's much more convenient to recharge the battery at home and plan ahead than to find a store to buy batteries, as they might be easily available in the US, but that's not true in many other parts of the word). Where I live, 4 AA batteries cost over USD4.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia Fowler
Reviews.Content: Shipment arrived in less time than projected. Packaged very well and it has been a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't Do it
Reviews.Author: M. Wagner
Reviews.Content: I can't describe my disappointment.  I am a casual photographer that likes to have a camera in my hands almost every day-- walking the dogs in the fields etc.  While not knowledgable, I did take a few courses back in college, and used an SLR - 20 years ago, so I understand the basics, I know my way around the dial.  I wanted just a "jump up" from my point and shoot Canon Powershot, and LOVED the idea of a wide angle and 20X without the bother.  This camera looked IDEAL on paper, and after looking around for months, I bought it.  After 5 days, I have NO DECENT PHOTOS at all.  I went so far as to take along the Point and SHoot to snap them side by side, and most photos are better w/ the Point and Shoot - even on exact settings.  For starters, the IS definitely either is not working at all or VERY poor :-(.  I can't find a single photo that is in focus -- indoors w/, w/out flash, on different settings..... outdoors in plenty of light and on different settings as well.  For the first time EVER in my life, I'm going to go through all the bother of packing it up and returning it -- what a pain..... what a SHAME.  I had high hopes.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX20IS
Reviews.Author: Steve W.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on reviews and recommendations from others and found it was extremely "hard" to use. I'd use the auto focus feature and every shot was out of focus. I ended up buying the camera from another local store which had 100% satisfaction return policy. Got my money back and i'm looking for another camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Deuel "D. Deuel"
Reviews.Content: Shipper was very fast with getting my Camera to me.  Canon is the best Camera I have used so far!

Reviews.Title: where's the damn manual
Reviews.Author: ABYDavis "ABY"
Reviews.Content: Yada, yada, where's the manual?  I was shocked when I opened the book and found a glorified brochure for a manual.The camera isn't a kodak instamatic.  It has a ton of fffffeatures.Features, does the camera have features?  Well, yes it does.  But you have to either read onliine or print up a ton of pages to figure out the features.  I don't want to lug around a paper bound notebook.  I don't want to lug around my computer to look up something about the camera while I'm out shooting.For $400. bucks, they could include the books.The manufactuer should be ashamed of being so cheap.

Reviews.Title: poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: xi
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product through Amazon because I saw lots of people have given it good reviews and ratings. After I received it and used it to take some pictures for two days, I was disappointed. I was very disappointed by its poor picture quality. It looks great from outside and feels great in my hand. But the color, sharpness and overall taste of the pictures coming out it are no better than a $100 digital camera. The picture quality is the core of a digital camera. I am going to return it. You really have to use it by yourself to determine whether you like it or not.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: J D "classy and real"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera with great features but I find it too bulky and for the price I believe it should have come with at least a carrying case. The pixels are true to form, thus good quality photos...nice

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in November of 2009 and 8 months later, the thing was eating my batteries like crazy.  I would place a new set of batteries in and the camera immediately tells me they are bad and needs to be changed when the batteries are brand new!  Would not recommend buying this camera!

Reviews.Title: extremely bad focus
Reviews.Author: jdc
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to having a great camera with a great zoom. I have owned many Canon products dating all the way back to my film SLR Canon AE-1 Program from the 1980's through a number of digital point & shoots. All of them were great cameras of their day. I expected this to be the best yet. Unfortunately, it was the worst. Right from the get go, the pictures taken with this camera were either slightly out of focus or extremely out of focus. I have never experienced a problem like this before, with any camera. I called Canon and they had me reset the camera to the factory defaults. This made no difference. Canon then wanted me to send it in for service. I returned it instead. Thanks Amazon for giving me my money back. I'm pretty sure i just got a lemon because thousands of others report loving this camera. I wish i was one of them.

Reviews.Title: Heavy and bulky camera
Reviews.Author: CMT "cmt215"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for work and did not purchase or pick it out myself.  Comparing it to the Sony DSC-H10 that I have at home, I really don't like the Cannon.  Here's why:-The lens cap doesn't have a cord to connect it to the camera.  You have to keep track of it or you'll lose it.-The camera is really heavy.  It takes 4 AA batteries and the batteries alone make the camera heavy.  (My Sony is MUCH lighter with the one rechargeable battery.)-The Duracell batteries that I use don't last very long.  I use the large screen to take pictures and while I know this takes more battery juice than if I used the viewfinder, I feel like the battery life is really low. I don't even want to think about how much money I've spent in batteries this past year.-It isn't a one button deal to over-ride the automatic flash.  There are times when the flash doesn't go off and I want it to and it it's a several button process to get the flash to go.-There is a fairly substantial delay in the time it takes between taking a picture and being able to take another one.-With all Canon cameras you need to install software on your computer in order to view and download photos.  Again, with a Sony, this isn't the case.  This isn't a problem if you only download to one computer but if you want the ability  to download to other people's computers, it's something to consider.To sum up, it isn't a bad camera but the negatives outweigh the positives for me.

Reviews.Title: No advanced instruction manual
Reviews.Author: ms bonsai
Reviews.Content: I purchased the SX20 last week and was shocked to find out it had no paper advanced instruction manual - just a CDrom. I love my instruction books and usually carry these with me always with my camera. I have had a few Canon and have always been happy with their products. I am not much of a computer person - just transfer my pictures to my I-Photo on my Mack for printing. I may return this product only because of the lack of a manual.

Reviews.Title: Good enough... until it fails
Reviews.Author: Law Chick
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 2.5 years, and prior to today, would've given it a 3 star rating. I've never thought the picture quality was particularly good UNLESS you are shooting in bright natural light. Also, the camera is slow, and it's aggravating that the manual is online.  However, I was generally satisfied with the camera due to the price, zoom, and good outdoor (daytime) shots.Today the camera malfunctioned. It stopped recognizing shots I had just taken ("unidentified image") and then spontaneously deleted hundreds (but not all) of the photos on the memory card. The card is not corrupted.  I found one other instance of this happening to someone with this camera.  I could get a new card and hope for the best, but I've been using this card since December with no trouble, and don't believe the card is the problem.  I cannot recommend this camera.  If you're on the fence about a DSLR, spend the extra money and get it.  If you really want a point and shoot, just don't get this one.

Reviews.Title: Questions/Help!!  This thing shakes and ticks.
Reviews.Author: Confused
Reviews.Content: Just bought this 3 weeks ago and on numerous occasions it makes ticking noises, shakes, vibrates, and other strange internal noises.  Is anyone else having similar experiences with this camera?

Reviews.Title: canon sx 20is
Reviews.Author: Ralph W. Hall
Reviews.Content: I would have rated it a 5 star if it would have had a printed instuction manual. It needs this because you can't take advantage  of it without it.

Reviews.Title: I so wanted to love this camera
Reviews.Author: Sally "Gal"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this model specifically for the articulating viewer.  I had an older Canon with this feature and vowed never to get a camera without it if possible.  This feature and the fact that it was a Canon, was all I needed.I have now had the camera for 6 months.  The quality of photos I have gotten are great.  The problem is the number of photos opportunities I have missed due to 1) user error 2) design flaw.1) PLEASE camera designers, don't locate the on/off switch anywhere near the shutter button; best would be to put it on the opposite side altogether.  Granted I should learn from my mistakes, but when a great shot becomes available, my head and my hand do not always coordinate correctly.  This has happened too many times to count.2) This device eats batteries so quickly that I am wondering if there is not some electron kick-back from the bunny to the shutter-maker.  This camera gives no warning of low power so when the batteries fall below a certain strength, no pics.Pros:  I'm short and at the Ralley to Restore Sanity in DC I was able to hold camera above my head, see the shot I wanted with the articulating viewer, and those times I didn't depressed the power button, I got some great shots.Overall, I like the camera for the quality of the photos but because of the info above I can't rate it higher.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Arthur Long
Reviews.Content: The camera has a few quirks, as no indoor lens setting function, flash is irregular, The only way one gets better light gathering in the daytime is in bright sunlight, in shaded settings with the camera in auto mode, the picture is to dark and loses details. Also the camera is not good in auto mode on close ups, and will not focus any closer than 5 to 6 feet distance. The flash button on the top left side of the camera is in an inconvenient place when holding the camera to take a picture. Inadvertant pressing of this button, interrupts the zoom function and delays the camera getting ready for the next shot. In my estimation and I am a big Canon fan, having in my possession two Canon XLR's, that this camera while compact, is below the standards I expect to see in a Canon product.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Henry "comvox"
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking it is a great camera.  If you are going to buy one be prepared to spend a little time learning what all the buttons are for.  Since I don't use the camera every day I sometimes forget how to do things.The only minus - I bought a more expensive 17 - 85 Canon Zoom lens as I was not impressed with the picture capablities of the included standard lens once I got it. This created some other problems as the new lens does not fit in the Canon case I purchased.  If I were to do it over, I would have purchsed a body only and the 17-85 lens.Other than my problems it is a great camera.  I own two Nikon FTN professional film cameras and gnerally am judging it against them.

Reviews.Title: The best camera that I have used
Reviews.Author: Chuong Hoang Mai
Reviews.Content: The camera is so nice. It easy to use, easy to carry. The camera also records video. Hence, it is so useful for me.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot 30sx is
Reviews.Author: J. stigliano
Reviews.Content: don't buy this camera  canon power shot sx30is!! as a big fan of canon and especially cannon customer service  this canon power shot sx30is camera is very slow.  you will miss many good pictures if you buy this camera. . when speaking with canon tech support they said this is normal even after we reset the camera to mode P and then continuous shooting af to what they felt would make it faster. it had the same problem in this mode as we had in normal auto mode before.....its still very slow.........canon support was no help with this problem and could care less even when i asked could i get some kind of credit so i could buy one without this problem especially  since it was only 6 months old and i used it 5x...flat out NOi don't normally write reviews but this camera is terrible so if its between canon or panasonic buy panasonic as you get a lot more for your money and are very fast...sorry canon a very unhappy customer

Reviews.Title: ALMOST  EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Bill McLean "Serious Enjoyment"
Reviews.Content: To me, the most important difference between the SX20 and the D3i is the price.  I purchased my SX20 Canon Factory Refurbished - for $300.  (I saved $80.00 or more.) It looks and performs as if new.  Even $400.00  is a great price.  I paid a lot more for my T2i SLR and it doesn't have an articulating LCD.-Comparing the quality of my XS20 images with the T2i, there really is only small differences in sharpness.  At least with most of my enlargements.  This is surprising to me because of the difference in image sensor size, and the remarkable zoom range of the lens being 18X.  All this and with a rather fast maximum aperture of f2.8.  SLR's have no lenses that compare with this range, and the big zoom lenses that fit the SLR's are much heavier.Mostly I don't use the LCD view screen.  The viewfinder is faster.  But I will use it when photographing plants.  And we all know other uses for the articulating LCD - shooting over heads - getting down to child level - etc.I appreciate the small size, easy handling, and the light weight of this camera. Also, when I'm unsure of what settings to use, I can quickly set the XS20 on Intelligent Auto mode.  All this makes it tempting to leave my Rebel T2i at home when the SX20 will do the job.  See my photo postings at the top of this advertisement.Only two things bother me about the SX20:  (1) It doesn't record photographs in RAW format, and (2), Regular and Burst setting modes are slow. This is not a fast action camera.I can't think of anything else that bothers me about the SX20.  Again, I give it FIVE-STARS for price, utility, image sharpness, and ease of handling.  Even if I were a pro I would want to own one and put it to use8/26/11 UPDATE:I forgot to mention the AA NiMH Batteries.  I would have much preferred lithium.  The rechargeable AA batteries have a shelf life of about five years, and don't hold a charge.  They get progressively weaker faster, MUCH FASTER, than Lithium batteries.  And Alkaline AA's are not cost effective.  Lithium batteries hold more energy and stay charged for months.  Almost all other digital cameras are now powered by lithium batteries.Another thing I forgot to mention, the SX20 has a Hot-Shoe and will work with Canon Speedlites and many other brands.  This is a big plus.However, while I still think this is a great camera for semi-serious photo bugs, I'm changing my rating from 5-STARS to 4-STARS, and my EXCELLENT to ALMOST EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Patrick J. Conmy "Pattyboy"
Reviews.Content: I received this three days ago and have used it ever since! I LOVE IT!!! It is by far excellent quality HD still pictures. It is simple to use and provides professional quality pictures. I am still trying to figure out the video and other features of he camera; but it's fairly straight forward to use just out of the box! BUY THIS CAMERA, YOU WILL BE PLEASED AT THE RESULTS!!!!

Reviews.Title: nice features poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Douglas G. Haring
Reviews.Content: Highlight areas all over exposed. Sub par color saturation/balance and contrast lead to flat looking images in what should be great lighting situations. Disappointed -bought and returned.

Reviews.Title: Una camara Excelente!!!
Reviews.Author: Brady G. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Es una muy buena cámara fotográfica ... tiene muchos elementos .. y Herramientas para tomar una foto de excelente calidad

Reviews.Title: Canon SX20IS 20x
Reviews.Author: J. R. Restrepo
Reviews.Content: Es una excelente cámara. El poder que tiene el zoom (20x) es extraordinario. Es fácil de manejar. Para mi lo único que le hace falta es que se le pudiera adaptar un filtro UV o skylight para proteger el lente.

Reviews.Title: This camera is a clunker
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I finally graduated from my trusy ol Canon Power Shot S3IS,6.0 megapixel to thejust released Power Shot SX20IS.I primarily use my camera for motor sport events and am a hobby photographer even though I've been shooting at the track for years. The only thing I like about the SX20IS is the improvemnent in sharpness. Otherthan that, Almost every photo I've taken from the last few outings are useless.The camera for some reason has aweful white balance and washes out anything witha larger degree of white in the subject.This happens shooting in auto mode or inaction mode where iso is automaticaly controlled. There is also a slight degree of blureyness on any photo that has action to it.Once again,letting the camera stay in auto or action modes which sets shutterspeed,the shots are not clear. Perhaps this is a defective camera? I will sendback to Amazon and see how they will deal with it.Personally I think this cameranot designed well for action shots. It does do well with portraits the few timesI used it. I may count my losses and buy the Nikon D5000 with articulated viewfinder the my Canon's have.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Suu
Reviews.Content: Good and I love it. But I am not happy because I could not find receipt when it is shipped to my address.

Reviews.Title: service review
Reviews.Author: marianne tallarico
Reviews.Content: I had to return the camera as It would not fit the particular underwater attachment it was meant for  I carefully unwrapped the camera, did not damage the box and did not unwrap batteries ETC, when I e-mailed the  place it came from  he said return it but would have to charge me a re-packinging fee, I have never heard of this  He charged almost $[...] the camera was  [...], credit was [...], he said the camera had fingermarks on it and it had to be sent out for  cleaning  I found that to be a real stretch considering how careful I was  It cost me [...] to return it fedex with insurance as he was most anxious for return So it was a very costly,  unpleasnt b experience  So the product  was fine except it did not meet my use but the source it came from was most unpleasnt

Reviews.Title: Excellent Seller
Reviews.Author: Fred Bown
Reviews.Content: I got the camera faster than expected and it was the best price I could find anywhere

Reviews.Title: Camera Fun
Reviews.Author: A. Daniels
Reviews.Content: I have a trip planned to the Holy Land and wanted a camera with good zoom.  I believe this will handle my needs but can report more after this trip.As of now, the only change I could suggest is some way to make a more sturdy lens cover or one that could be attached to some type cord.  This may be the first thing I loose.

Reviews.Title: Having trouble with .mov files
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: Cannot figure out how to burn the video files onto DVD using Windows DVD maker, never had any problems with the .AVI files from my old camera. I've tried video converters and calling canon, no luck. Anyone have any ideas?

Reviews.Title: refurbished? RIGHT
Reviews.Author: Olevet "I do love to read on my Kindle Fire, ...
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this purchase, The camera lasted all of 3 uses! first time no problems,2nd time started rejecting the memory card and it went downhill from there. Will never buy refurbished again!

Reviews.Title: overall nice but some disappointing issues
Reviews.Author: disappointed
Reviews.Content: overall nice camera but disappointed with a few things :- shutter shade interferes with images with and without flash.- bought Hoya lens protector that supposed to fit but it didn't. Have not look everywhere but seems difficult to find lens protector (non canon)- auto mode is disappointing. takes too long to focus in some situations- picture quality without flash in low light environment is not good. my previous cheaper powershot A90 seems to be better but LCD monitor died after 2 yrs.

Reviews.Title: Did not meet my expectation
Reviews.Author: LZGNY
Reviews.Content: canon s5 that i had before was taking better pictures than sx20. when you zoom in picture is blurry ,noisy ...returning my purchase after 3 days use.

Reviews.Title: I sent it back
Reviews.Author: Gnarley
Reviews.Content: Hard to eat hamburger after you've had steak. I will not go into an extended review of the whys..Suffice to say that if you have never used a high end DSLR but rather just a P&S..this; will be a great camera for you and you will love it. But, if you're used to higher end equipment, pass it by.

Reviews.Title: not worth it
Reviews.Author: S. Alavattam
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon dSLR (Rebel XT) and am very familiar with using a camera with many settings. In fact, I adore my Rebel and bought the Canon Powershot SX20IS because I am impressed with Canon products. However, I never got any useable photos from various field trips and/or portraits that I took from the SX20IS. I originally bought this for my wife (photography novice) to use, but she rejected it because of its photo quality and bulk and returned the product after several failed attempts to get good pictures. The video quality was nothing to write home about either. Maybe I should stick to my Rebel XT for now.

Reviews.Title: don't buy
Reviews.Author: Joanna L. Vaughan
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera after my Sony DSC was accidentally shattered (so upsetting).  I wanted a 12mp and Sony didn't have the same model in 12mp so I went with the Canon after reading such amazing reviews. I had a bad feeling when, after opening the package, 4 AA batteries fell out.  I kept an open mind and loaded the batteries and tried it out.  7 out of 10 pictures I shot were blurry.  The color was horrible.  The focus was all over the place.  I knew this wasn't the camera for me. Back to the hunt for another Sony!

Reviews.Title: WARNING - This camera does not accept filters
Reviews.Author: Men'sRightsActivist "GottKinder"
Reviews.Content: Although the lens appears to have threads for the screwing on of filters, it does not.  Unless you take a magnifying glass and look for the actual threading pattern you too may be deceived into buying a camera that you think will take filters, but doesn't.  Is that deceptive advertising on the part of Canon?  If not, what exactly is Canon trying to accomplish by putting fake threads where real threads should be to accept filters?One of the main rules of photography is (when you buy a camera in this price range), "Install a filter to protect your lens."  My Sony is a couple of years old now, and sold for about $100 less, but it has threads to accept filters.  I returned my Canon SX20IS in disgust and will never buy another product from Canon, a company that apparently thinks so little of its consumers and cameras it doesn't even provide a basic means to protect an expensive investment, while pretending to.  What else might I be overlooking that Canon isn't telling me?

Reviews.Title: No manual = no camera.
Reviews.Author: Scott Bringhurst
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last week.  I returned it yesterday.  The camera only comes with a basic, printed manual.  The in-depth manual, the one that any novice user is going to need is included on disk ONLY.  This means that you have to lug your computer around if you want to refer to the manual while learning to use the camera.  Who's doing that?  When I called Canon to inquire as to my missing manual, they told me that I could print the manual from the disk.  Yeah, right.  On my dime.  I already spent hundreds of dollars on their camera and now they want me to spend even more money (and time) to print my own manual?  BS!!  They said this was part of their "going green" program. Well, guess what?  Canon ain't getting any of my green.  I returned the camera and bought a Nikon P90 for the exact same price. The Nikon has two manuals the size of the Bible.  One in English and one in Spanish.  Viva Nikon!It also appears as though the Nikon has more useful features for me.  I own an eBay business and I can actually edit the photos that I take within the camera itself (cropping, borders, light, etc.).  This will save me time.Perhaps the Canon does the same, but I wouldn't know because they were too cheap to print me a manual.I wish I could comment on the workings of the Canon camera but without a proper manual, I couldn't really learn how to use it.  On the day I did attempt to use the camera, I kept having a problem with the macro auto-focus.  The images were blurry 50% of the time.  When I switched to manual macro-focus, the images were blurry and dark, plus there was a meter of some sort directly in the center of the screen which I couldn't figure out how to remove (or use).  It was then that I sought out the manual, only to find it missing.  Wading through the online manual was an aggravation that I simply did not want to hassle with, especially when I had work that needed to be done.What if I hadn't been near my computer when I had some question about the camera's function?  Tough luck, I guess.Bottom line, this is not a camera for a novice and I would not recommend it to anyone.  Heck, even if you're not new to digital cameras or photography, you still need to know how to use specific functions on a new camera.  It is absurd to think that you must sit in front of your computer and learn, rather than take the camera into the real world and learn as you go.
